loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita manages a general store business. She is requesting for a loan that will serve as added capital in buying stock like canned goods, noodles, seasonings, and more products to sell. She has been in this business for 20 years and most of the time, she has earned an income of PHP 2,500 monthly that has been used in supporting her grandchildren's needs and saving for future use. 

Nenita is now 57 years old and a mother of three children. She is now widowed and living happily with her two children and grandchildren in the village of Nagbitin.

loans.use: buy stock like canned goods, noodles, seasonings, etc to sell.

loans.name: Janeffer

texts.en:
Janeffer is a single mother of one child and her child doesn’t go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (a young brother). She resides in a rented house and the family has access to neither electricity nor piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and rent 

She has a business of selling used clothes  and has been in  this business for seven years and sells on a retail basis only. She moves door to door selling used clothes. 

She has applied for a loan of 700,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. Her major business challenges include rainy season, which hinders her movements.  She is aspiring to get a permanent business premise and also to build her own house.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Sin's Group

texts.en: Sin is a widowed mother with seven children residing in Pursat province’s Sampov Meas district. To overcome the family's hardship, she sells corn and raises pigs while her husband works at a construction site. Having engaged in her current business for 10 years, she is able to earn almost up to 22,000 KHR per day. With VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), she and other two borrowers are asking for their first-cycle loan. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy wood to build walls for her house. She hopes this purchase will help her in time.

loans.use: To buy wood to build walls for her house

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda is 51 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Esmeralda is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase additional feed to sell.

Esmeralda has been raising livestocks for 2 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed to sell

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma is a 45-year-old married man with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. For eleven years he has been running a retail shop, but also earns a salary as a teacher. Like most traders, he is challenged by price fluctuations and high license fees. His desire is to expand his business to a new area. 

Juma intends to use the loan to buy popcorn and eggs to sell.

loans.use: to buy popcorn and eggs to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy items like soap, sugar, salt and other retail goods

loans.name: Gaudius

texts.en:
Gaudius is 32 years old and married with six children and one dependent, whom he looks after due to the death of his parents. Gaudius is an agriculturalist who majorly deals in coffee growing. He owns about four acres of coffee plantation in his region. He also operates a retail shop of  UGX (Ugandan shillings) 1,000,000 capital, where he generates additional income to supplement his income. 

From the income realized from coffee sales, he has managed to look after his family and construct for them a permanent house. However, Gaudius’ biggest challenge is inadequate income to pay school fees for his children. On top of that, seasonal changes affected his earnings, as most of his coffee was hit by sunshine and dried up.

He is applying for a loan of 800,000 Ugandan shillings to buy fertilizers for his coffee plantation. 

His dream is to see all his children study up to university.

Gaudius is honest and hardworking.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers.

loans.name: Caeser

texts.en:
Caeser is 30 years old and struggled to find a job after school. He therefore started a small stationery shop with some money from his brother. He has been in this business for three years now and he sells his stationery to local residents around Kyotera.
Caeser has requested this loan in order to re-stock his business and supply his clients adequately in this season when students and pupils are going  back to school.
His major hope is to expand his business so that he can start selling on a wholesale level. However, he has a challenge of limited capital to expand the business and low demand of these items during periods when schools are closed for holidays.

loans.use: To buy scholastic materials to sell

loans.name: Kolis

texts.en:
A young mother of one kid living in a village of the Phnom Proek district, Kolis is 25 years old and married. Her kid is too young for school. The source for her family's income is mainly from corn, soybeans and cassava farming. She has been in this business for three years. 

Kolis has been with Kiva's partner, VisionFund, for two loan cycles already, and she completely paid back the previous loans, which enabled her to improve her family's living conditions. 

Now she is seeking a new loan of 4,000,000 KHR in order to pay for her farming, such as growing soybeans, and she will use a portion of the loan to pay for raising pigs. With this loan, she hopes to make enough income that she can set aside some money to send her kid to school and also extend her farmland.

loans.use: to pay for her farming.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti lives in Likoni, Kenya. She is 50 years old and married with two children. She has been running a food café for the last two years and the business has been doing great. She has been able to employ two people to help her run the business well. In five years time she wants the café to have grown into a restaurant that will generate enough income for her family. 

She knew about Milango through friends who invited her to join so that she could save and access credit to fund her business. She is now seeking a loan to buy maize flour, wheat flour and cooking oil for the business. The challenges that she faces include competition and customers not paying on time. Extra income from the loan will improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy maize flour, wheat flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en:
Oliver is a single mother, age 40, living in Kagadi, Uganda. She works in the local government, but also operates a boutique dealing in second-hand clothes. A good mother that she is, she desires to educate her children up to the University and to buy land for farming. 

Oliver intends to use the loan to buy land.

loans.use: to buy land.

loans.name: Asastazia

texts.en: Asastazia is a 40 year old hard working woman living in Fort Portal, Uganda.  She sells fresh foods but also practices farming in order to earn a living.  Her challenges include perishability of her stock due to lack of adequate preservation equipment.  Her dream is to own refrigerators. Asastazia  intends to use the loan to buy fresh foods to sell.

loans.use: to buy fresh foods to sell.

loans.name: M. Nawaz

texts.en:
M. Nawaz is 47 years old and lives with her family in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 
He is the father of three children and all of them go to school.  He is a cattle trader by profession, buying cattle from different villages and selling them to the butchers. Now that Eid-ul-Azha (Muslim religious holiday) is about to come, demand for cattle will increase. In these days, he sells his cattle to the common people. Also during these days, the demand for bull calves peak. Every year in this season he offers a bull calve to the common people. He brings his all bull calves to the animal market and stays with the cattle 10 to 15 days. After selling his cattle he goes back to home to celebrate Eid festival with his family. 
M. Nawaz wants to buy more bull calves to sell in the market but he lacks funds this year.
Therefore, M. Nawaz requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner so that he could buy more bull calve to sell. He hopes that he will pay all the installments on time. With the profit, he will buy new dresses and shoes for his family to celebrate the Eid festival. 
He hopes that this season he will be a more profitable business than before.
M. Nawaz is very pleased after taking this loan and is thankful to the BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy bull calves to sell.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
Cesar tiene 28 años, está casada con Amalia y tiene 1 hijo, con quien vive en su casa propia. Siempre tuvo gusto por la cocina iniciándose en pequeños negocios de comidas en distintos puntos de su localidad.
Esto le sirvió para hacerse conocido y a la vez obtener buenas ganancias que le permitirían obtener buenos ingresos para hacer posible la apertura de un local y posteriormente convocar a dos ayudantes debido a la buena clientela. Se caracteriza por tener una buena sazón en la preparación de platos a base de pescados  y mariscos tales como ceviche, chilcanos, parihuelas y otros de alta demanda siendo también caracterizado por la higiene y buen trato. Lleva 5 de experiencia y esto lo motiva a cumplir uno de sus principales objetivos que es la adquisición de un local propio a futuro para mejorar sus ingresos con la mayor asistencia de clientela. Este es su segundo préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Desea en esta oportunidad contar con 2,000 nuevos soles para la compra de pescado fresco al por mayor ya que es un experto en este tipo de comidas.
texts.en:
Cesar is 28 years old, married to Amalia, and has one child.  They live in their own home.  Cesar has always enjoyed cooking, so he started small food businesses in different parts of town.  

Cooking has helped him to become well-known and to earn a good income.  Since he has been able to generate good profits, Cesar opened a restaurant and eventually hired two assistants because of the good clientele.  Cesar is known for preparing delicious fish and seafood dishes such as “ceviche” (seafood marinated in citrus juice), Peruvian fish soup, seafood stew, and other foods that are in high demand.  He is also known for his cleanliness and for providing good service.  Cesar has five years of experience, which has motivated him to fulfill one of his main objectives of acquiring another shop of his own in the future so that he can improve his earnings and serve more customers.  

This is his second Kiva loan and he appreciates the financial support he has received that will allow him to continue forward.  In addition, Cesar promises to complete his payments in a punctual manner.  He is taking this opportunity to borrow 2,000 PEN so that he can buy fresh fish in bulk since he is an expert in these types of dishes.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish in bulk.

loans.name: Tina

texts.en: Tina is 41 years old and married with 2 children. She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as sugar, rice, salt, onions, etc. She has been doing this for 2 years. Tina needs a loan to buy bags of rice, flour, sugar and salt, onions, tinned fish, tomato sauce, noodles, toilet paper, snacks, cigarettes and crates of Vailima (brand) beer. She hopes to use her profits to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice, flour, sugar and salt, onions, tinned fish, tomato sauce, noodles, toilet paper, snacks, cigarettes and crates of Vailima (brand) beer.

loans.name: Flormelyn

texts.en:
Flormelyn had engaged in direct selling but stopped the business. Now, with the lenders' help, she is requesting a loan to pursue her Avon direct selling and soap retailing in her village. With the support of the loan, she will buy bigger volumes of soap from factories in Bulacan Province and will also reactivate her Avon dealership. 

She is now 37 years old with four children. Her husband works as a regular driver for the Pepsi company. Her ultimate goal in life is to support her children's education so they could have a better life than she has had. She once has the chance of completing her college but did not.

loans.use: to buy bigger volumes of soap from factories in Bulacan Province and also to reactivate her Avon dealership.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 36 years old from Nakuru. She is married to Peter who is a mechanic, and they have three children aged 13, 10 and 7 years old.

She owns a general store which has been in operation for the last year, and since she wants to replenish her stock she has applied for her second loan of Kshs 40,000 from Kadet Ltd.

Eunice's income right now is Kshs 18,000 per month and she intends to use the profit from her expanded business in renovating her residential house.

Her hopes and dreams are that in the future she will educate her children to the highest level possible.

loans.use: To buy more stock for her general store, e.g. phone accessories, and the rest to be used in paying a bill for the connection of electricity.

loans.name: Mon's Group

texts.en:
Mon, 44, is the father of five sons. He lives in a rural area of the Mongkul Borey district. All of his sons are dependent on him and still in school. He has been planting rice for 30 years as the main source of his income while his wife earns extra income by growing vegetables. Currently, Mon can earn around 45,000 KHR per day. 

This is the second loan for Mon’s group with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. He has completely repaid the previous loan, which improved his family’s living condition and enabled him to keep his sons in school. Mon is requesting a loan of 1,200,000 KHR while his other group member is applying for 500,000 KHR. Mon, who is the leader, wants to use his portion to buy fertilizer, vegetable and rice seed, and to pay a portion of plowing fees. With this loan, he hopes to make more income so as to enlarge his business to raise cows.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, vegetable and rice seed, and to pay for plowing

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Vitolia

texts.en: Vitolia is a 46-year-old single mother of two children. She makes and sells sandwiches, pork cake, pancakes and coffee in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business. Vitolia needs a loan to buy boxes of milk, coffee mix, foam cups, black coffee, eggs, mayonnaise and onions. She plans to use her profits to improve the quality of her business to support her family. Vitolia became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy boxes of milk, coffee mix, foam cups, black coffee, eggs, mayonnaise and onion

loans.name: Mwanakame

texts.en:
Mwanakame is a hardworking and enterprising woman. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Mwanakame makes dumplings which she sells to neighbors and passersby. She cites seasonality as her major challenge.

With the Kshs 15,000, she wants to purchase wheat flour and cooking oil for her business. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income and establish a restaurant in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour and cooking oil for her business.

loans.name: Siniva

texts.en: Siniva is a 35-year-old woman who is married with 6 children. She has a small business operating taxi services. She has 2 years with this business. She needs a loan to buy car brakes, seat covers, new tires and pay for a taxi registration renewal. She will use her profits to support her family. Siniva joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy car brakes, seat covers, new tires and pay for a taxi registration renewal.

loans.name: Irma

texts.en: Irma is a 27-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband and parents-in-law in a small village of Khashuri district. Irma is pregnant. The family is involved in agricultural activities. They have land where maize and haricot are grown. They work hard and always have high-quality products that are sold to local retailers. Irma decided to start an additional business and requested a loan for it. The start-up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 1,200 GEL and purchase a cow. They have a shed for the cow in their yard. Irma and her mother-in-law will milk the cow every day and will produce cheese to sell. The start-up program will be a great support for the family.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Lilian Njeri

texts.en:
Lilian grew up and got married in central Kenya. This is the region with coffee, tea, and dairy farming. Its also the region that has had a lot of problems with deforestation, hence there have been water shortages in the recent years. Lilian is no exception from the millions of women who use wood and dung fuels for cooking and kerosene for lighting. Their income levels can not enable them to install and sustain electricity energy. The situation is not easy now that the forests are reserved and therefore getting wood is becoming harder. Like her neighbors, she has to suffer every weekend walking up and down the hills to go fetch water and collect wood to last her a week so that she can till the land during weekdays.

Lilian learned about VEP and the biogas project during a training at her church, and determined to resolve the fuel issue she approached VEP to help her construct one at her home. She has received a biogas loan and started the life-changing project that will see her and her family become empowered with cleaner, cheaper, and more efficient fuel. This will also save her one day in her weekends to rest and be with her children. The biogas will also supply her with light so she will not need to buy kerosene anymore. This will be good for her children who need to study in the evening and can now enjoy more study hours. We believe this will improve their grades. With the monthly income from tea and the sale of milk from her three cows, Lilian will be able to repay the loan, and once she clears she hopes to purchase a water tank to store rainwater and solve her water problem as well.

loans.use: To construct a bio-digester

loans.name: Rat's Group

texts.en: Rat is aged 60 and is a villager from Battambang province's Moung Russey district.  She is married and has five children who have their own employment.  Rat grows rice on two hectares of farmland.  Having been in this business for 40 years, she is able to earn about 20,000 KHR per day to support her expenses and can afford to save about 5,000 KHR per day.  This is the third loan cycle for Rat and the first-time for her one group member.  She has completely paid back the past loan to VisionFund.  The first loan has helped her improve her living conditions.  To support her current business, Rat and her group member are applying for a loan in total of 1,500,000 KHR.  As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland.  With this loan, she hopes to grow healthy rice and hopes to increase her rice yields so she is able to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Teing

texts.en:
Teing is 35 years old and married. She lives in a village located in the Phnom Proek district of Cambodia. She has three children, one of whom is still in school and another one is too young for school. Her primary source of income is from the rice and corn plantation of a six-hectare farmland. She has been in this business for several years. 

She is applying for a loan of 2,000,000KHR to buy fertilizer, insecticide and seeds for her farmland. This is the third loan for Teing with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, and she has completely paid back the previous loans. With this loan, she will be able to buy decent food for her family. She hopes to increase her crop yields and make a better life and keep her children in school until tertiary level.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, insecticide and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Seat's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village located in the Ek Phnom district, Seat is 30 years old and married with three children, one of whom is still in school. She is a tailor, while her husband is a motor-taxi driver, to earn income to support their family. She has been in this business for several years. This is the second loan for Seat’s group of three members, and they successfully paid back the previous loan from VisionFund. 

The past loan helped Seat to provide her children with decent food. She can earn around 41,700 KHR per day from her current business. She is leading her group to apply for a loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fabrics for her business and to pay her family’s daily expenses. With this loan, she hopes to increase her tailoring business so as to increase her family’s income and improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fabric for her business.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en: Christina is 20 years old and single with 1 child. She wants to start a small business of making and selling cooked food such as taro, fried chicken and so on in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy a box of chicken, bags of flour, onions, oil, foam plates and foil. In the future, Christina hopes to expand her business. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a box of chicken, bags of flour, onions, oil, foam plates and foil.

loans.name: Losa

texts.en: Losa is 47 years old and married with 5 children. She wants to start a small business of making and selling German buns in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy bags of flour and sugar, oil, yeast and a frying pan. In the future, Losa hopes to expand her business. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour and sugar, oil, yeast and a frying pan.

loans.name: Ioana

texts.en: Ioana is 32 years old and single with no children. She makes and sells elei printed material to earn a living and has been doing this for four years. Ioana has requested a loan to buy fabric paint, brush, rollers, material, and elei carved designs. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy fabric paint, brush, rollers, material, and elei carved designs

loans.name: Ingrid Ivonne

texts.es: Ingrid de 24 años de edad, habita junto a su familia conformada por su esposo y su pequeño hijo. Es una mujer muy responsable con su hogar. Su compañero de vida trabaja como jornalero en una finca cerca donde vive, y juntos pagan sus gastos familiares. Ingrid tiene un deseo de encementar el piso donde vive, ya que tiene un corredor de tierra por salud e higiene por su hijo desea realizar esta mejora. Es por esa razón que solicita a FUSAI un préstamo para la compra de cemento, arena y otros materiales de construcción que necesite. Confía en que pronto podrá realizar ese sueño y agradece la oportunidad que se le ha otorgado.
texts.en:
Ingrid is 24 years years old. She lives with her family which consists of her husband and a young son. She is a very responsible woman toward her household. Her life partner works as day labor on a farm close to where they live and together they pay the household expenses. Ingrid wants to finish the floor where they live in cement, as there is now a packed-earth corridor. She would like to make this improvement for the health and hygiene of her son.

For this reason Ingrid is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand and other construction material that she needs. She hopes to be able to realize this goal and is grateful for the opportunity given to her.

loans.use: to buy cement and construction materials that she needs.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a very hardworking lady from Nakuru. She is 37 years old, married to Cyrus who produces additional income for the family, and has one teenage child aged 16 years old and in school.

She has a business of selling timber which she has been running for the last three years. To enable her to dedicate more time to her business, she has applied for her third loan of Kshs 30,000 from Kadet Ltd. which will be used to buy a gas cooker for use in preparation of meals for her family without wasting time, so as to create more time to be spent in her business.

Her monthly income at present is about Kshs 30,000 and she hopes that in the future she will have a fulfilled life.

loans.use: To buy a cooker for use in her home.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.en:
Alejandrina is a 41-year-old woman from the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. She is married with five children ages 8 to 21. Her husband is a fisherman. This is his means to support them.

Alejandrina has spent 21 years helping her husband in their fishing business. She makes sure that she can assist him in whatever he needs in fishing. She is asking for a loan to buy fish net, crab traps, and lead weights to ensure continued business. 

In the future, she hopes to expand her business and increase business profitability for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy fish net, crab traps, and lead weights

loans.name: Duterintambwe I Group

texts.fr:
Alice fait parti du groupe DuterintambweI et habite à Gitega. Elle  a 28 ans et est mariée à  Pasteur, un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants âgés de 4 mois  à 10 ans, dont 3 étudient.

Elle fait le commerce de la  bière depuis 4 ans.

Elle est à son huitième crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit Kiva qu’elle obtient, elle va augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de régime de bananes pour la transformation en bière de banane, à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les années à venir, elle voudrait voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Alice is part of the Duterintambwe I group, and lives in Gitega. She is 28 years of age and is married to Pasteur, a retailer. Together they have four children between the ages of 4 months and 10 years, three of whom are at school. 

Alice has worked selling banana beer for four years, and is on her eighth loan with Turame. With this Kiva loan, she plans to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of bananas, which she will use to make banana beer to sell and increase her income. Over the coming years, Alice would like to see her children go to school.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of bananas, which she will use to make banana beer to sell and increase her income

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty lives in Likoni, Kenya. She is 30 years of age and she is married with three children. All her three children attend school. She has been in the business of selling clothing for more than five years, and this business is the sole income earner for her. She knew about Milango through a friend and advertisements, and now she seeks a loan to buy five bales of secondhand clothes to sell. The major challenge in her business is the competition from other traders. The extra income she will raise will help her educate her children and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy five bales of secondhand clothes.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is married and has four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are household consumables.

For over four years, she has operated a rental house business.  She cites seasonality as her major challenge.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to buy cement to renovate two rooms for her business continuity. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy cement to renovate two rooms for her business continuity.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en: Henry is a resident of Malindi, Kenya.  He is a 32 year-old married businessman with four children.  He runs a motorcycle transport business that has been in business for the last three years.  When not ferrying people from one point to another, he is farming.  The business has been doing fine and now he seeks a loan to buy a motorbike.  He knew Milango through friends and he decided to join so that he could access credit to fund the business.  The challenge for the business is the weather. During the rainy season most people do not prefer motorcycles.  The extra income that he raises will improve his standard of living and allow him to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Rana

texts.en:
Rana knows challenges and will never be afraid to face them. While everyone told her she is out to fail with her project, she kept working harder and harder until she proved them wrong.

Rana is a 35 years old Iraqi woman, she is married and a mother of 3 children. Five years ago her husband was paralyzed and since then she is the sole provider for the family. Facing a tough situation others might not have been able to handle, Rana took matters into her own hand.

Using the small land they had, she had a store built which was gradually filled with various goods. With great intuition about supply and demand, she purchased items for retail her customers could only buy in different towns before. With 5 years experience and a well built reputation, she is now able to attract many customers and carry many items from basic household goods to clothing and accessories for every member of the family.

Her growing business qualifies for the WLIFT program as Rana is taking a SME loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq in the amount 12,500 USD. Rana plans to use the loan to improve the current store and also to add small electrical appliances to her current stock.

Rana is confident, and her strong personality and persistence to succeed will surely help her succeed  She is not only growing into a respected local business woman but also is a great role-model for success to her children and other women in her area. 

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to improve the current store and also to add small electrical appliances to her current stock.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 40 years old and married with four children, ages 8 to 14, who all attend primary school. He lives in Kyotera town with his family. 
Peter is a businessman who operates a bar. He supplements his family income with a monthly salary.
Peter works 18-hour days seven days a week. He has been in this business since 1990. He started it with the aim of earning a living because at the time he started this bar, he had no job.
He has acquired this loan to boost his business by restocking all the desired drinks for his customers. His main customers are local residents from his area.
His dream is to improve his standard of living by constructing a modern home for his family and to be able to provide daily bread for them.
His greatest challenge is lack of enough capital. He describes himself as a hard-working man.

loans.use: To buy drinks for his pub

loans.name: Roberto Carlos

texts.es: Roberto Carlos de 35 años de edad, vive junto a sus padres y sus hermanos. Es un hombre trabajador y visionario que desea darle lo mejor a sus padres. Con esfuerzo y dedicación ha ido construyendo su hogar le ha costado pero lo ha logrado, y desea con muchas ansías poder tener luz eléctrica propia pero no tiene los recursos suficientes para la realización de esta es por eso que solicito a FUSAI un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción como  cable y conexiones eléctricas y caja térmica. Su forma de ganarse la vida es como jornalero y cultiva semillas, granos básicos etc. Y luego los vende es así como asegura el pago de dicho credito
texts.en:
Roberto Carlos is 35 years old and lives with his parents and siblings. He is a hardworking, forward looking man who wishes to do the best he can for his parents. With great effort and dedication he has managed to build a home; it was difficult but he did it. 

He wishes to be able to install electric lights but he doesn’t have enough money so he is seeking a loan form FUSAI to buy construction materials such as cable, electrical connections, and electrical box. Roberto Carlos earns his living as a labourer and plants seeds so he can grow basic grains. By selling them he will be able to pay back the loan.

loans.use: buy construction materials such as cable, electrical connections, and electrical box

loans.name: Lavalenesi

texts.en: Lavalenesi is 41 years old and married with seven children. She runs a small business selling ice cakes in her community and has been doing this for six years. Lavalenesi has requested a loan to  buy cordials, sugar, foam cups, large spoons, and Chinese candy. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Lavalenesi will help with her children's education.

loans.use: to buy cordials, sugar, foam cups, large spoons, and Chinese candy

loans.name: Lilia

texts.es:
La señora Lilia tiene 35 años, está en pareja con el señor Francisco, tienen 2 hijos aun pequeños, ella es comerciante, ya que tiene una despensa bien surtida en la ciudad de Ita.
Allí provee a vecinos y amigos de todo tipo de insumos de primera necesidad para el hogar como carne, verduras, leche, carbón, bebidas en general, embutidos y otros productos, mientras que su marido Francisco tiene una panadería también en la ciudad de Itá hace varios años.
La señora Lilia solicita el préstamo para la compra de diversos tipos  de insumos para la despensa a modo de aumentar su stock de mercaderías y pueda generar mayores ventas y por ende más ganancias, como ser verduras, comestibles en general, carnes, y demás. Ella agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya y a Kiva por la oportunidad recibida y se compromete a abonar sus cuotas en fecha ya que en el futuro desea agrandar su negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Lilia is 35 years old and in a common-law partnership with Sr. Francisco.  They have two small children.  

Lilia is a merchant who manages a well-stocked food pantry in the city of Ita.  She provides her neighbors and friends with all types of basic household necessities such as meat, vegetables, milk, charcoal, beverages, sausages, and other products.  Meanwhile, her husband Francisco has managed a bakery in the city of Ita for several years.  

Sra. Lilia is requesting this loan so that she can buy different types of products for her food pantry.  This will enable her to increase her stock of merchandise and generate more sales and profits.  She plans to buy vegetables, general food products, meats, and other items.  Lilia is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the opportunity she has received, so she commits to submitting her payments on time.  She would like to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, general food products, meats, and other items.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 51 years old and married with three children who are in school.

She has a business of selling vegetables in Naivasha which she has operated for 25 years. She has applied for her first loan from KADET Ltd to enable her buy vegetables for sale. With anticipated profits, she plans to pay school fees.

In the near future, she hopes to be the biggest tomato supplier in Naivasha market.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes and potatoes.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo is a 35 year-old man from the town of Bien Unido, Bohol.  He is married with five children ages 2 to 14.  His wife stays at home to look after their children.  

Alfredo works hard as a fisherman in order to provide for his family's needs.  Out of this business, he usually earns 4,000 PHP per month.  He is asking for a loan to buy floaters, nylon and fish net that will help make his livelihood easier. 

His income from fishing is his main source of money for food and to pay school fees for his children.

In the future, he hopes to expand his business and to successfully let his children finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy floaters, nylon and fish net

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 60 years old, married and has five children.  

Lolita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Lolita requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Lolita has been raising pigs for eight years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Lolita would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Mwanahawa

texts.en:
Mwanahawa is asking for a new loan because she believes that through it she will improve her business.
 
The previous loan enabled her to to save money to renovate her family house. However, she still operates the motorcycle business. She is requesting a loan of KES 10,000 to purchase spare parts for her motorcycle. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for her motorcycle

loans.name: Mwanarusi

texts.en:
Mwanarusi is a married woman with no children. She lives at her own house that neither has piped water nor electricity. 

Mwanarusi has operated a beauty salon business for the past four years. Her potential customers are women. She dreams of earning more income and building her own house in the future. 

With the KES 15,000, she wants to purchase braids, weaves, hair chemicals, hair oil, shampoos, and hair conditioners. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase braids, weaves, hair chemicals, hair oil, shampoos and hair conditioners.

loans.name: Kimwana

texts.en:
Kimwana is married with seven children.  She owns a house that has electricity and piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Kimwana has operated a fish selling business at the market for the past ten years, selling to her town dwellers and neighbors. 

Kimwana is requesting a loan to purchase bundles of fish, cooking oil and firewood.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans at lower cost so she can  improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish, cooking oil and firewood.

loans.name: Buud Nooma Group

texts.fr:
Mme FELICITE  est la représentante du groupe BUUD NOOMA. Elle est  mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 08ans et le moins âgé a 05mois.  01 va  à l’école. 
Elle vend des habits depuis 05ans. Elle s’approvisionne  au marché du secteur 10. Ses clients sont  les hommes et femmes.
Elle veut  s’acheter 10douzaines d’habit pour garçons, 12douzaines d’habits pour filles.
 Mme utilise ses bénéfices pour réinvestir dans  son activité. Elle ambitionne  élargir le champ de son activité et mieux s’occuper de sa famille. 
NB : Mme Félicité a réintégré  le groupe.
texts.en:
Madam Félicité is the representative of the group Buud Nooma. She is married and mother to 3 children. The oldest is 8 years old and the youngest is 5 months old. One child goes to school.

She has been selling clothing for 5 years. She gets her supplies at the market of sector 10. Her customers are men and women.

She wants to buy herself 10 dozen outfits for boys and 12 dozen outfits for girls.

Madam uses her profits to reinvest in her business. Her ambition is to expand her field of business and to better take care of her family.

NB: Madam Félicité has rejoined the group.

loans.use: to buy herself 10 dozen outfits for boys, and 12 dozen outfits for girls.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is from Iraq. He is a youth client 25 years of age, single and he lives with his two brothers.
Ali owns a small shop where he sells mobile phones and accessories. He also specializes in repairing mobile devices and has mastered what he practices. Ali established his business in 2011 and has been in this field for almost nine years. Ali has good experience in what he practices and has become well-known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.
Ali is requesting a youth loan of 2,400 USD. The aim of this loan is to buy a specialized piece of equipment used to repair mobile phones. Ali is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so that he may provide more services for his society and a bright future for himself.

loans.use: to buy a specialized piece of equipment used to repair mobile phones

loans.name: Temple Eliel Group

texts.fr:
Mme T. CLARISSE est la responsable du groupe TEMPLE ELIEL. Mariée, elle est mère de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 7ans et le moins âgé a 03ans. 01 va à l’école. Elle a 02 personnes en charge.
Mme vend des condiments  depuis 07 ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de toecin. Ses clients sont  les femmes et hommes.
Mme veut s’acheter  15 boites de  tomates,01 bidon d’huile de 20l pour revendre en détail, 01sac de gombo etc.
Elle veut réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité.  Mme ambitionne étendre les limites de son activité et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Madam T. Clarisse is responsible for the group Temple Eliel. Married, she is mother to 2 children. The oldest is 7 years old and the youngest is 3 years old. One goes to school. She has 2 people under her care. 

Madam has been selling condiments for 7 years. She gets her supplies at the market in Toecin. Her customers are women and men. 

Madam wants to buy herself 15 boxes of tomatoes, 1 20L can of oil to resell retail, 1 bag of gumbo etc.

She wants to reinvest her profits in her business. Madam's ambition is to expand her business and improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy herself 15 boxes of tomatoes, 1 20L can of oil to resell retail, 1 bag of gumbo etc.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Henry is a resident of the Mombasa Changamwe area, Kenya. He is a 37-year-old married businessman with two children. He runs a motorcycle transport business that has been operating for the last four years. The business has really grown and he has been able to employ two young people to run the business for him. This business is the sole income earner for him and now he seeks to increase his income and seeks a loan to buy another motorbike. In the next five years he wants the business to grow, and he hopefully wants to run a light transport business. He knew Milango through a friend and he joined so as to access credit for his business. The challenge for the business is weather. Extra income will improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy another motorbike.

loans.name: Yoeurt

texts.en:
A resident from Battambang province’s Ek Phnom district, Yoeurt is 44 years old and a married mother of four children. Currently, she needs to take care of only three children, as they are in school. To cover the daily cost of living, she does paddy rice farming on a two-hectare area and also sells grocery items for supplementary income. She has been with this business since she was 29 years old. 

She is a first-cycle client with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The requested amount of this loan is 4,000,000 KHR. Yoeurt will spend this loan to buy more grocery items for resale. She hopes to replenish this business on time so that she can continue to earn a good profit for her family, which has enabled her to keep her kids in school.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items for resale.

loans.name: Perpetual Waithira

texts.en:
Perpetual is a member of a group called Thirwa in Central Kenya. She is a farmer and a business lady operating a small shop next to her house. She joined VEP in 2012, and since that time she has been able to benefit from renewable energy, having bought her first solar lamp and cleared her debt. Happily, she shares with us how much she has enjoyed life while using a solar lantern that helped her save at least 50% of the money she previously used on kerosene. The lamp she bought could be used in the sitting room for her children to study, during dinner and for the master bedroom. She would then only need to buy a little kerosene for her kitchen lantern, which the children would also use in their bedroom. 

For this loan, she would like to take a solar package that comes with four lights so she can have light in every room, charge mobile phones and power their small radio. The other older lamp can then be used in the shop to serve the evening customers instead of using a candle. This way she can open her shop for longer hours. With the package she will not have to buy kerosene anymore or pay to have her phone charged. This means a lot of savings for her and convenience for her family.

loans.use: To purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en: Mom, a villager from Battambang province, strives for a living by rice farming on two hectares of land and by tailoring clothes. She is 34 years old and has three children to take care of. Her business, which she has had for 12 years, has enabled her to generate almost 32,000 KHR per day. With this new loan, Mom will be a fifth-time borrower whereas her co-borrower will be a six-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The positive impact of Mom's past loans has enabled her to repay her loans and to support her living better than before, especially in purchasing household appliances and three meals a day for her family. Now, Mom leads a group of two to get a new loan. She is seeking 1,200,000 KHR while her fellow group member is seeking 800,000 KHR. As the leader, Mom will spend her loan portion to pay a reaping fee and to buy fertilizer for replanting her crop. Mom hopes that she can gain a good crop output and keep her children in school until tertiary level.

loans.use: to pay a reaping fee and to buy fertilizer for replanting her crop.

loans.name: San Francisco Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SAN FRANCISCO” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Viviana es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de verduras, producción de chompas, producción de tejidos, empresa de textiles, venta de frutas, venta y producción de mantas, venta de verduras, taller de costura, flete de triciclo.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Viviana es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una asesora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de frutas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años al estar apoyando a su hermana que tienen el mismo negocio, posteriormente cuando tuvo su pareja decide establecer su propio espacio de comercio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de fruta) que adquirirá de las ferias tradicionales, por mayor, y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área el ahorro.
texts.en:
The SAN FRANCISCO Communal Bank will start its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Senkata Regional Center. It is composed of nine members and is led by a board of directors of which Sra. Viviana is president. The members of the communal bank run a variety of business including vegetable sales, the production of sweaters, the production of woven goods, a textiles business, fruit sales, the sale and production of blankets, vegetable sales, a sewing workshop, tricycle freight.

The loan that the members take out will benefit their small businesses. Sra. Viviana is a member and she notes that she joined Pro Mujer two years ago. She became a member at the invitation of a Pro Mujer advisor who came to visit her in her home. Currently she has a business selling fruit. She states that she learned this trade several years ago when she was helping her sister who has the same kind of business. Afterwards, when she had a partner, she decided to establish her own business space.

The loan she will take out now is to increase her capital to purchase fruit. She will get the fruit wholesale at traditional fairs and later will sell it at her sales stall. This kind of business enables her to generate funds to support her family since she lives in a common law relationship and has three children.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she enjoys the subject of savings.

loans.use: to purchase fruit.

loans.name: Primavera Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PRIMAVERA” iniciará el vigésimo sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Elsa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de faldas, venta de chompas, venta de papa y chuño, cerrajería, venta de verduras, venta de papa, venta de busos, venta de chamarras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Elsa es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de faldas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su amiga quien le enseño a realizar la costura de faldas, posteriormente decide establecer su propio taller y su espacio de venta.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela) que adquirirá de las ferias tradicionales, por mayor, y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es soltera y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro, los créditos y el área de salud.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Primavera” (Spring) is in its 26th loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes Community Center.  This group consists of eight members and is led by a Board of Directors in which Sra. Elsa is the president.  The members of this Communal Bank engage in different businesses such as selling skirts, selling sweaters, selling regular and freeze-dried potatoes, performing metal work, selling vegetables, selling potatoes, selling sweatshirts, and selling jackets.

This loan will benefit small entrepreneurs such as Sra. Elsa.  She says that she joined Pro Mujer a year ago after receiving an invitation from a friend who is a member of the organization.  Elsa currently has a business of selling skirts.  She became familiar with this business after a friend taught her how to manufacture skirts.  Eventually she decided to establish her own workshop and retail space.

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying fabric.  She will acquire her materials in bulk at the traditional fairs and then use them to make her products from her retail space.  Working in this manner enables her to generate income to sustain her family.  Elsa is single and has three children.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Elsa said that she enjoys the savings, the loans, and the health services.

loans.use: to buy fabric for making skirts.

loans.name: Los Angeles De Villa Adela Ii Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ANGELES DE VILLA ADELA II”  iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Adela, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Juana es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, costura de chompas, costura de polleras, venta de miel, venta de ovejas, venta de víveres, ayudante de nimibus, venta de vajillas, taller mecánico.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Juana es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando cuando vino a visitar al Centro Focal y averiguar a cerca de los servicios que se realizan. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de costura de polleras; este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años atrás, al aprender  la técnica de costura de sus primos que tienen el mismo negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de telas) que adquirirá de las tiendas mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará a pedido del cliente. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los servicios crediticios que tenemos.
texts.en:
The communal bank Angeles de Villa Adela II is starting its third cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of Villa Adela regional office. It comprises nine members and Juana is the President of its governing board. The members of this communal bank run a variety of businesses, including: selling food, sewing sweaters, sewing skirts, selling honey, selling sheep, selling provisions, bus assistant, selling dishes, a car repair shop.

The loan they are taking out will benefit the small microentrepreneurs in Juana's group. She says she has been a member of Pro Mujer for one year. She joined when she came to visit the regional office to find out about the services they provide. She currently has a business sewing skirts. She started her business several years ago when she learned the sewing skills from her cousins, who are in the same business.
 
She will use the loan she is taking out now to increase capital by purchasing fabric, which she will buy from the wholesale shops in the city of El Alto. After finishing her products she will sell them to order. This work allows her to generate resources to support her household as much as possible, since she is married and has four children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she tells us she likes the lending services we provide.

loans.use: to purchase fabric.

loans.name: Fe Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FE”  iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora María Elena es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: costura de chamarras, albañil, venta de verduras, macramé de mantas, venta de detergentes, carpintería, portera de escuela.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora María Elena es integrante, ella indica que hace un ciclo que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de salchipapas; este negocio lo emprendió recientemente al empezar a convivir con su pareja, decide seguir este negocio porque anteriormente ayudaba a su madre a la venta de producto.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de carne por mayor) que adquirirá de las distribuidoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The community association, "FE" (Faith) is entering its third business cycle with Pro Mujer and the Pan-American Focus Center. The group is made up of nine members and is led by a board of directors of which María Elena is the President. The group members make a living in various trades, including: blanket weaving, masonry, vegetable sales, detergent sales, carpentry, work as a school janitor, etc. 

The support from this loan will benefit the small business owners in this group, including María Elena, who joined Pro Mujer a year ago at the invitation of a friend who was already a member. María Elena operates a small business selling "salchipapas," a popular meat and fried potato dish. She started this business recently in order to cover important living expenses and support her son. María Elena learned the trade from her mother who also operated a food sales business. 

With the support from this loan, María Elena plans to purchase meat in bulk to stock her business. She buys her meat from wholesale distributors in the city of El Alto and then cooks and prepares it at her food stand. She hopes that this investment will help strengthen her business and allow her to support her son and her husband's family with whom she lives. María Elena's favorite aspects of being a member of Pro Mujer are the training sessions she receives in financial and medical wellbeing.

loans.use: to purchase meat in bulk to stock her food sales business.

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo is 43 years old from Talibon, Bohol. He is married with one child who is eight years old. He has been operating a sari-sari (variety) store business for a year now. He sell candies, chips, cooking oil, shampoo, detergent, and canned goods. He is asking for a loan to pay for boat repair and for the tuition fee for his child. His income provides food for his family and his daughter's education.

Danilo hopes that in the coming years he will be able to continually support his child’s schooling until she graduates from college.

loans.use: to buy noodles, canned goods, vinegar, soy sauce, shampoo, and seasoning

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn lives in Talibon, Bohol. She is 27 years old, married with two children ages three and five. Marilyn has helped her husband in their fishing business for three years now. She also farms bananas for additional income. She would like to be ahead and not to worry on their fishing inputs. With this, she is asking for a loan to buy weight leads, fish net and nylon.

This will help so they can catch more fish. She hopes that in the future they can have other businesses and will become successful in educating their children.

loans.use: to buy weight leads, fish net and nylon

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es: Tomas de 56 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y a sus hijos de 12 años, 10 años y 5 años; Siendo un hombre admirad por su familia y amigos se siente orgulloso de si mismo y su familia. El trabaja como jornalero en una finca cerca de su hogar. Es así como honradamente se gana la vida decentemente. Tomas desea cambiar el techo de donde vive ya que tiene 50 años de vivir en su casa que es propia por el tiempo ya se está dañando es por eso que desea reparar todo el techo de su vivienda y se acercó a FUSAI para la compra de materiales de construcción como lamina galvanizada, polines. Cuenta con buenas referencias de pago
texts.en:
Tomas is 56 years old and lives with his wife, and his children ages 12, 10, and 5. As he is a man admired by his family and friends, he feels proud of himself and his family. He works as a day laborer on a farm near his home. This is how he earns a decent and honest living. 

Tomas wishes to replace the roof on the home where he lives, as he has been living in it for 50 years and it belongs to him.  With time it is getting to be in poor repair, and that is why he wishes to do a complete repair of his roof.  

He has approached FUSAI so that he can purchase construction materials such as sheet metal roofing, and studs. He has good payment references.

loans.use: To buy construction materials such as sheet metal roofing for repairing his roof.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu operates a charcoal-selling business, She sells from home to her neighbors and she faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of incorporating firewood into her existing business in the near future.

With the loan she is requesting she plans to purchase six sacks of charcoal  for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support and she appreciates the support granted.

loans.use: to purchase six sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Mwanahawa

texts.en:
Mwanahawa has operated a clothes selling business, which she sells at the market to her town dwellers and her neighbours. She cites her major challenge to be the rate of stock turnover which is affected by seasons. 

With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase two bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and she appreciates for the support given.

loans.use: to purchase two bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Solidarite Group

texts.fr:
Mme ZENABOU  est responsable du groupe SOLIDARITE. Elle se porte ainsi que tout le groupe. Mariée, elle est mère de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 11ans et le moins âgé a 08ans. Les 02 vont à l’école.
Mme vend divers marchandises (friperie, sel, savon liquide) depuis 04ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de son quartier pour les friperies et chez les grossistes pour le sel. Ses clients sont  les femmes et  les voisins.
Elle veut s’acheter 05kg de pâte qui est utiliser pour la fabrication du savon, 03sacs de sel et des drats de lit friperie.
Mme veut ouvrir un compte pour épargner ses bénéfices. Elle ambitionne toujours devenir un grossiste et acquérir une moto.
texts.en:
Ms. ZENABOU is the official of the group SOLIDARITE. She is well, as is the whole group. She is a married mother of two children. The oldest is 11 years old, and the youngest is 8. The two are going to school. 

Ms. ZENABOU has been selling a variety of merchandise (used clothing, salt, liquid soap) for four years. She gets her supplies of used clothing at her neighborhood market and of salt from wholesalers. Her customers are women and neighbors. She wants to purchase 5 kg of pâte used for making soap, 3 bags of salt, and some secondhand bedsheets.

She wants to open an account for saving her profits. Her ambition is still to become a wholesaler and to acquire a motorbike.

loans.use: to purchase pâte used to make soap, salt, and bedsheets

loans.name: Vjollca

texts.en:
This is Vjollca, an Egyptian Albanian mother of three from northern Albania.  She lives in a town where the national hero’s tomb, Skanderbeg, is located.  There are not very many members of the Egyptian community in this city, just a few including Vjollca.  Like a majority of the members in her community, she has been suffering from health issues caused by unhealthy living conditions most of her life.  However, she is receiving a disability income.  Vjollca has been an active borrower from our institution since the very beginning, dating back to 2001.  Here is what she stated during her interview: “without the loans and this institution, it would have been very difficult for me and my family; and for this I am very grateful.”
Vjollca needs your help to repair the leaking ceiling shown in the picture.

loans.use: to repair the leaking ceiling in her family's home.

loans.name: Lenh's Group

texts.en: Lenh is 58 years old and a widowed mother blessed with three children. For her family, rice farming and clothes tailoring are the main income sources, which have earned her almost 21,000 KHR per day. Never having been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before, she leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy necessary materials to build a proper latrine for her family. She hopes that her kids will have good health because of hygienic practices.

loans.use: To buy necessary materials to build a proper latrine for her family.

loans.name: Chanra's Group

texts.en:
A rural villager located in Battambang province, Chanra is a young married mother of two children. Both her son and her daughter are too young for school. To provide for her family, she has been into rice growing on 1.5-hectares of her farmland as her main source of income, and she is able to earn about 46,100 KHR per day. She has been involved with this current business for 6 years. 

Chanra and two of her group members have never been with VisionFund before. Now she leads her group to apply for a loan from Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. As the leader, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to make good income to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Savy's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village located in the Ou Reang Ov district, Savy is a 56-year-old widow with two children. The main sources of her income are farming rice and selling groceries, which she has done for 38 years. With her business, her main challenge has been her low income. 

Savy is in her second loan cycle. She leads a group consisting of three members to apply a loan from  Kiva’s partner VisionFund. Savy has successfully repaid her past loan, which helped her make a good living. Now she is able to earn a daily income of about 25,800 KHR. As the leader of this group, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and grocery items for her grocery store. She hopes to make a good income and make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married, with four children.  Two attend school; one is too young, and one is an adult. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a business of selling "leso" cloth (a wrap for women).  She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of expanding to become a big supplier of clothes in the future.

With the KSH 20,000, she wants to purchase 30 pieces of leso cloth for resale. She decided to join Yehu to obtain loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 30 pieces of 'leso’ cloth for resale

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards.

She is requesting a loan of KES 50,000 to purchase onions, tomatoes, vegetables, and potatoes for resale. 

Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and to earn a higher income. She thanks Yehu Microfinance Trust for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase onions, tomatoes, vegetables, and potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy general electronics and mobile phone accessories.

loans.name: Abdul Latif

texts.en:
Abdul Latif is 37 years old and a responsible father of 2 sons and 5 daughters. He is living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

He is a milk man by profession. He has seven buffaloes for getting milk, a bull for breeding and many bull and heifer calves. He gets milk two times a day. His wife and daughters produce cheese, yogurt and butter from the milk. With the addition of these products he earns sufficient income to run a house. 

He has been keeping his cattle at home, and through breeding he has been increasing his number of cattle for many years, but now he does not have enough space at home to keep cattle. He is feeling a problem during getting milk and feeding his cattle in the congested atmosphere. He has an empty wide space beside his house, but does not have a sufficient amount of money to build a cowshed for his cattle. 

Therefore, Abdul Latif requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that he could build a cowshed and more easily increase his cattle. He hopes that now he will be able to easily carry on his business, and he would not be in any need of more space for cattle for many years. 

Abdul Latif has to pay for the marriage of his dear daughters, and he has to collect the dowry as well. He has to maximize his savings so that he could easily fulfill his responsibilities. He says thanks to Kiva and to its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to construct a cow shed.

loans.name: Makvala

texts.en: Makvala is a 38-year-old married woman. She lives in the Mukhrani district with her husband and son. Her husband is a carpenter and gets 250 Gel per month. Makvala has a poultry business. She has hens and sells eggs to local retailers. Makvala decided to expand her agricultural activities and to purchase calves. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of 2000 Gel for purchasing calves. Makvala will raise them and will produce dairy products to sell in future. This will increase the income of her family and she will be able to improve the living conditions of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Victor  Manuel

texts.es: Don Víctor de 56 años de edad, vive en casa propia con su esposa  y sus dos hijos de 15 y 12 años de edad ellos estudian actualmente, él se dedica a la agricultura  desde hace 15 años siembra maíz y frijol, es una persona trabajadora y dedicada a sus labores, con lo que obtiene de sus ingresos logra solventar algunos de las necesidades de su familia, Víctor esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícola como: fertilizantes, abonos, semillas, herbicidas, etc. con esto espera brindarle a su familia una  mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Víctor, who is 56 years old, lives in his own house with his wife and two kids of 15 and 12 years old. They are currently going to school. He has been working in agriculture for 15 years planting corn and beans. He is hardworking and dedicated to his work. With what he gets from his income, he will be able to straighten out some needs in his family. Víctor is requesting a loan for the purchase of agricultural supplies such as: fertilizers, manure, seeds, herbicides, etc. With this, he hopes to provide his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies such as fertilizers, seeds, herbicides, etc..

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy basic grains, chicken, meat, oil, dairy products, and cold cuts.

loans.name: Bernabe

texts.en:
Bernabe is 40 years old from Talibon, Bohol. He is married with four children aged 8-17. Like most people from this place, he relies on fishing for a living. Bernabe is doing the same. He has been fishing for 15 years now. He is asking for a loan so he can continue to sustain his business. He will use his loan to buy hooks and fish net and to pay for the labor on his house renovation. He works hard so he can support his children. 

In the future, he hopes to have a comfortable house for his family.

loans.use: to buy hooks and fish net and to pay for labor on his house renovation

loans.name: Jhoanna Smith

texts.es:
Jhoanna es una joven de 20 años, que vive en la ciudad de Imperial. –Johanna desde muy joven tuvo al necesidad de trabajar, ya que su familia no tenía muchos ingresos económicos. Dia a dia Johanna trabaja como obrera en un fundo agrícola en un fundo de su ciudad, ella trabaja alrededor de 8 horas al día y con el fruto de su humilde trabajo saca adelante con mucho esfuerzo a su pequeño hijo de 8 años de edad; Jhoanna cree que está saliendo adelante porque tiene la mejor motivación que alguien puede tener, el cual es su hijo.

Jhoanna está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado podrá comprar mas conejos y materiales para la construcción de jaulas, ya que actualmente ha iniciado un pequeño negocio de venta de cuyes y conejos, de esta manera podrá mejorar su negocio y podrá mejorar sus ingresos, así seguirá luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Estudiar la carrera de contabilidad y darle una profesión a su hijo”.
texts.en:
Jhoanna is a young woman who is 20 years of age and lives in the city of Imperial.  She needed to work at a very young age because her family did not have a lot of financial resources.  Day after day, Jhoanna works as a laborer on a farm in her town.  She works approximately eight hours a day and the fruits of her humble work have enabled her to get ahead with great effort along with her eight-year-old son.  Jhoanna believes she is moving forward because she has the best motivation that anyone could have, which is her son.  

She is extremely grateful to the Kiva lenders.  Thanks to the assistance they have provided, she will be able to buy more rabbits and materials for building cages.  At the moment, Jhoanna has started a small business of selling guinea pigs and rabbits.  This loan will enable her to improve her business and increase her earnings.  She continues to strive toward fulfilling her greatest dream of studying for a degree in accounting and helping her son pursue a profession.

loans.use: to buy rabbits and materials for building cages.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is asking for a new loan because she believes that with it, she will improve her business.

The previous loan enabled her to to save money to operate a food-cooking business. She cooks beans and chapati (flat bread). However, she still operates the cashew nut-selling business. She is requesting a loan of KES 50,000 to purchase wheat flour, cooking oil, and beans.

She feels that she was able to make a good investment with her previous loan, which to date has allowed her to maintain her level of profits to help her family cover their personal expenses.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, cooking oil, and beans.

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en:
Stanley is 48 years old and is married. He is blessed with three children, ages 19, 17 and 6 years old. He has an educational academy in Nairobi town. He has run it for 14 years. 

He plans to use this loan amount to buy school desks and lockers, and also plans to develop the academy by renovating and building more classrooms. This is his 3rd loan term and he paid his previous loans successfully. 

Stanley hopes to be successful in life.

loans.use: To buy school desks and lockers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cosmetics, perfume, and women's clothing

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael lives in Likoni, Kenya. He is a 37-year-old married businessman with five children. Four of his children attend school. He has been in the quarrying and block making business for the last seven years, and the business has been growing despite the usual challenges with lack of transportation and high fuel costs.  

He knew about Milango through friends and now seeks a loan to buy more work tools and be able to employ people to work at his site. The extra income that he will raise from the business will improve his standard of living and he will also keep his children in school. He hopes that in the future he will own a vehicle to transport blocks to the clients' place of work.

loans.use: to buy more work tools.

loans.name: Romik

texts.en:
Romik is from Metsamor vilage, where he lives with his parents, his wife, and two daughters. 

Since 1995 Romik has provided repair service to locals. In particular, he repairs phones aand other electrical equipment. He is already very skilled at his job, and locals value his hard and good quality work very much. His business helps Romik to sustain his family's standard of living.

Now for purchasing tools and equipments to help him in his work, Romik needs financial support. He has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. So this loan will greatly assist Romik to have tools and equipment that will make his work effective.

loans.use: to pay for tools and equipment for providing repair service

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to support her coffee crop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bananas, oranges and mangoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his degree expenses.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.es:
Erlinda, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo para colocar variedad de mercadería; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar carnes, huesos, chorizos, entre otros. 
El crédito anterior le permitió mantener el negocio y sus ventas son bastante estables; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado. Su deseo es agregar otro tipo de rubro y ampliar su vivienda, asimismo sacar adelante su familia.
texts.en:
Erlinda needs to take out another loan to buy a variety of merchandise. This investment will help her buy meat, bones, sausages and more. 

The previous loan allowed her to maintain her business and her sales are very stable. Her financial condition and family circumstances have improved. She wants to add another activity and make her house bigger as well as get her family ahead.

loans.use: to buy meat, bones, sausages and more.

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
Juan  de 39 años de edad, estudio segundo grado, es casado; su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos  y a cuidar a los niños en casa, mientras don Juan sale al trabajo, ellos tienes 3 hijos que viven en su casa, de los 3 niños solo estudia la niña mayor que tiene 8 años tercer grado, además  en su vivienda vive la mamá de don Juan, en total  las personas que habitan en el hogar son 6 personas.

Él presta sus servicios de vigilancia, desde hace 3 años y su lugar de trabajo es un banco, ubicado a distancia de su casa de 10 kilómetros y para transportarse caminar un kilómetro para abordar el autobús. Aprendió este trabajo porque ya había prestado su servicio militar y esto le facilito mas  poder aprender del trabajo, el horario de trabajo es de 7:00 AM  a 4:00 PM.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para remodelar su vivienda, en la compra de materiales de construcción, le permitirá darles una mejor calidad de vida a su esposa, mamá e  hijos, estarán menos expuestos a adquirir enfermedades y a contaminantes y le permitirá salir de la vulnerabilidad de peligro que tiene su casa y estar en un lugar cómodo confiable y sobre todo seguro 

Su sueño, es tener una casa segura y digna,   para toda su familia y vivir mejor, que sus hijos sean mejores que él  profesionalmente y  que estudien una carrera  universitaria  cada uno de los 3 niños.

El préstamo le ayudara a satisfacer un necesidad que anhelaba, hace años de remodelar su casa que por fin siente que se le a hecho realidad el sueño de tener una mejor casa para vivir con su familia.
texts.en:
Juan is 39 years old. He went to school through the second grade and is married. His wife and his wife takes care of the home and the children while Juan works. They have 3 children at home, and only the oldest, and 8 year old girl, goes to school. She is in the third grade. Juan's mother also lives in their home. In total, there are are 6 people in the home.
