He has been a security guard for 3 years and he works in a bank located 10 kilometers from his house. He walks a kilometer to take the bus. He learned this work because he had already done military service and this made it easier to learn the job. He works from 7:00 AM to 4:00 PM.

The loan he is asking for is to remodel his home by buying construction materials. This will allow him to give his wife, his mother and his children a better quality of life. They will be less exposed to getting sick and to pollutants and they will be less vulnerable to danger and be in a comfortable and above all safe place. 

His dream is to have a safe and worthy home for his whole family,to live better, and for all of his 3 children to have better jobs than him and to go to college. 

This loan will allow him to satisfy a need he has had for years and remodel his house. He thinks his dream of having a better house to live in with his family has finally become a reality.

loans.use: to remodel his house and buy construction materials.

loans.name: Menay

texts.en: Menay is 35 years old and lives in Kakata Town, the capital city of Margibi County. She is unmarried and has three children between the ages of 5 to 16; all of them attend school. For the past two years she has been operating a table where she sells vita, oil, rice, onion, rice, salt, etc. Sometimes she has fewer customers, but most of the time she make a lot of profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more vita, oil, rice, onion, rice, salt, and other items to expand her business. In the future, she hopes to expand her business into a big store.

loans.use: to purchase more vita, oil, rice, onion, rice, salt, and other items to expand her business.

loans.name: Apolonia

texts.es: Doña Apolonia se encuentra muy feliz ya que con su primera solicitud de crédito ella pudo comprar los insumos para sus cultivos de papa con la que obtuvo una excelente producción 50 quintales los cuales vendió a muy buen precio y pudo salir con su compromiso de crédito. Las ganancias fueron muy buenas y re invirtió en sus cultivos una parte y la otra fue destinada para un semillero de papa certificado el cual pudo obtener esta vez para poder cultivar. Además ella pudo hacer una mejora en su casa de habitación construyendo una pared de ladrillo en su casa la cual era indispensable para poder hacer una división. Su negocio tuvo un cambio porque mejoro su producción gracias al primer financiamiento como también su calidad de vida ya que los ingresos obtenidos eran los esperados hasta tal punto que sobrepasaron sus expectativas. Por lo que esta vez han decidido solicitar un segundo crédito con el cual puedan sembrar la semilla que actualmente tienen en una mayor cantidad y poder preparar la tierra nuevamente para el nuevo producto ya que es necesario por el mantenimiento y protección de la misma para poder sacar buenos resultados.
texts.en: Apolonia is very happy because with her first loan request she was able to buy supplies for her corn crop.  She obtained a crop yield of 50 quintals which she sold at a very good price and was able to repay the loan.  Profits were very good and she reinvested part in her crops and the other was used to buy certified potato seed from a nursery which she was able to get to plant.  She was also able to do some home repairs building a brick wall at home that was indispensable in order to divide a room.  Her business changed because production improved thanks to the first loan.  So did her quality of life because income earned were as expected, they even surpassed her expectations in fact.  Therefore, this time she’s decided to request a second loan to plant the seeds she now has in larger amounts and to be able to prepare the soil once again for the new product because it’s necessary for crop maintenance and protection if results are to be good.

loans.use: to buy certified potato seed and to prepare the soil for planting.

loans.name: Khisrav

texts.ru: Хисрав уроженец города Куляб и начинающий бизнесмен. Ему 33 года. Он женатый человек и отец двух дочерей, которым по 5 и 3 года. Хисрав со своей семьей живет у родителей. В данный момент Хисрав собирается начать торговый бизнес. Его интересует торговля продуктов питания. Хисрав рядом со своим домом построил помещение для магазина и закупил одну витрину с холодильником и два морозильника. Теперь для открытия магазина ему необходимо закупить товар. С такой целью он обратился за кредитом. На запрашиваемую сумму Хисрав хочет купить ассортимент продуктов питания и начать торговлю. Именно с вашей поддержки он сможет открыть свой торговый бизнес.
texts.en: Khirsav is a native of the city Kulob and is a beginning businessman.  He is 33 years old, married, and the father of two daughters, who are 5 and 3 years old.  Khirsav and his family live with his parents.  Khirsav is preparing to start a commercial business, and is interested in selling food.  Khirsav built a room next to his home for his store and purchased a display case with a refrigerator and two freezers.  For the opening of his store he now needs to purchase products.  With this goal he asked for a loan.  With the requested amount, Khirsav wants to buy an assortment of food and start selling.  With your support he can open his own business.

loans.use: to purchase food for the opening of his store

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 49 years old and is from the municipality of Talibon, Bohol. She is married with six children, ages 9-24. 

Elvira is struggling to meet the needs of her family if she only depends on her husband. So she helps him with their livelihood which is fishing. Aside from her husband doing the fishing, she helps by selling fresh fish for five years now. She is asking for a loan to buy more fresh fish and shellfish to sell.

She hopes that in the future, she will be able to expand her business and have a better income so she can provide her family well.

loans.use: buy fish and shellfish

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is married with one child and her child goes to school. She also takes care of additional family members (sister and brother). She has a restaurant business and has been in this business for five years. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas, onions, charcoal, beef, chicken, and Irish potatoes. She doesn’t have any other income-generating activity. She works in the shop seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include thieves and seasonality. She aspires to own a fully stocked restaurant and also to buy a plot of land and build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of green bananas, onions, charcoal, beef, chicken, and Irish potatoes

loans.name: Peres

texts.en:
Peres is 61 years old.  She is married to Peter and they are supporting five children.

Peres has a restaurant business in Naivasha which she has operated for 28 years.  She has applied for her first loan from Kadet Ltd to enable her to buy stock such as beans, flour, tomatoes, among other items. With the anticipated profit, she plans to pay school fees.

In the near future, Peres  hopes to buy a plot of land and build a house where she will be running a hotel.

loans.use: buy food ingredients for her restaurant

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 32 years of age, married to Naserian and is a father of two young children. He is employed in the motorcycle transport business. He learned about KADET from other riders in the town. He has been in the business for the last three years with a monthly salary of KES 15,000.

Simon has acquired his first loan of KES 91,065, which will enable him buy his own motorcycle. This will enable him to make more income. He will use the proceeds to meet his family's basic needs. 

Simon hopes to own a car in the near future.

loans.use: buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti operates a charcoal selling business. She sells from home to her neighbors.   In addition, she has a business of selling goods at retail to earn a living and support her family well.  She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. 

With this loan, Mwanasiti plans to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support.

loans.use: buy charcoal to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 47-year-old very industrious lady who supports a family of five members, including two of her grandchildren.  She learned about Kadet from a loan officer who was doing a marketing campaign in Narok town.

Esther runs a bookstore as well as supplies books and other studying materials to the schools within Narok town.  Her monthly income is approximately KES 150,000. She has acquired her first loan of KES 100,000 which will facilitate her buying books in bulk, especially as now when most of the schools are re-opening for their third term.

The increased proceeds will be used to develop her plot of land. Her dream is to be the major book supplier in the region.

loans.use: buy books to resell

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is married with seven children who attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

Mwanakombo operates a cashew nut business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby.  In addition, she also does a business selling cooked food.  She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  Her dream is to establish a big restaurant in the near future. 

With this KSH 40,000 loan, Mwanakombo wants to purchase seven sacks of cashew nuts for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: buy cashews to sell

loans.name: Kimchen's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of Kampong Cham province’s Ou Reang Ov district, Kimchan is a 56-year-old mother of two children. She and her husband are farmers who grow rice and raise cows to make a living. Together, they can earn about 16,000KHR per day from the current business and can manage to save about 8,000KHR each day.

Kimchen has been with VisionFund for one cycle. She completely paid back the loans with VisionFund. The past loan has helped her better support her family. Now she and her group member are applying for a loan. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her family’s income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Sokkeng

texts.en:
A married mother of five children living in the Sa Ang district of Kandal province, Sokkeng is 58 years old and she makes a living by selling rice soup and coffee while her husband is a teacher. With 10 years of experience in this business, she is able to earn up to 15 USD per day and save 8 USD per day.

Sokkeng joins Kiva’s partner VisionFund this cycle as a second-time borrower. She is going to use this loan to spend on her son’s education, the tuition fee for the two years of her son’s Mathematics master degree program. She hopes this loan will enable her to keep her son in tertiary education until graduation and also help relieve the financial burden for her family so that she can sustain and grow her business.

loans.use: To pay for her son’s education fees

loans.name: Phalla's Group

texts.en:
Phalla, 23, is married and lives with her husband and one child in a village in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. She and her husband are farmers who grow cassavas on 2 hectares of farmland. Having been in this business for three years, she is able to earn about 7,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.

Phalla’s group consists of two members who are both female. She is a third-cycle client while her co-member is a fifth-cycle client with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund.  

Phalla has successfully paid back her past loans, which have helped her relieve the financial burden for her family and improve their livelihood. Now she is requesting another loan with VisionFund. 

Phalla, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her cassava farm. She hopes to increase her crop yields and earn more income to better off her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: buy fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Pok's Group

texts.en:
Pok is 23 years old and married with one son. To make a living, she has been farming rice and supplementing her income by working for others for a fee. She has been in agriculture business for 6 years. The current business earns her family about 27,000 KHR per day to feed the family. 

This is Pok's first cycle with VisionFund.  She is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farm and use a portion of it to spend on labors. She hopes to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: by fertilizer

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Sengleap's Group

texts.en:
Aged 44 years old, Sengleap is a widowed mother of two children living in a rural village in the Ou Reang Ov district, Cambodia. To support her family, Sengleap has been farming rice and washing motorbikes in the village. The current business earns her about 25,000 KHR per day. 

Sengleap has been with VisionFund for one cycle. She has successfully used the past loan from VisionFund to better support her family and business. Now leading her group to ask for a new loan, Sengleap will use her portion to buy fertilizers and gasoline for her farm. She hopes to increase her crop yields and sell it for a good price to make a better living.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and gasoline

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is a 47-year-old woman who lives with her husband in the town of Talibon, Bohol. For five years now, she has been raising hogs for an income.

She is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy more piglets to raise and a calf that she can start to add to her stock for expansion. She knows that her income always provides food for her and her husband. 

Antonia hopes that with her hard work, everything will pay off and she can have savings in the future.

loans.use: to buy a calf and piglets

loans.name: Nhong

texts.en:
Residing in the Baray district of Kampong Thom province, Nhong is 60 years old and married. She has six children. She has struggled to make a living though farming rice and selling grocery items. She has engaged in this business for several. 
Nhong has been with Kiva's partner, VisionFund, for two cycles. She completely paid back the past loans which have helped her improve her standard of living. Now, she is applying for a loan to pay for the school fee of her daughter. She hopes that the loan will enable her to keep her daughter in university to pursue the degree so as to find a good job after graduation and also help her to relieve her financial burden.

loans.use: To pay for the school fee of her daughter

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 40-year-old single business lady. She is a mother of two children who fully depend on her. Esther has been selling second-hand clothes for the past six years with a monthly income of Ksh 8,000, which she uses for her family's upkeep. 

Esther is applying for her sixth loan with KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully. She will use the loan to buy more clothes for resale. 

With the expected profit from the business, she will repay the loan and pay the school fees for her children. 

Her hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and build a good home for her family.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is 43 years old and from Nakuru. She is married to Nicholas, who is a businessman, and they have six children aged 24, 20, 18, 16, 12 and 7 years old.

She operates a business of selling fish and vegetables, and she has been doing this for the past 14 years. She has applied for her first loan of Kshs 20,000 from KADET Ltd so as to enable her to buy more stock for this business.

Her monthly income at present is Kshs 10,000, and her intention is to use the anticipated profits from her expanded business to pay the school fees for her children.

In the future, Pamela hopes to open more fish and vegetable stalls in her area.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of fish and vegetables to sell to her customers

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 40 years old from Nyahururu. He is married to Mary who does not produce additional income for the family and he has two children aged 10 and 8 years old.

He is a potatoes vendor and he has been in this business for 13 years. He has applied for a loan of Kshs. 20,000 from Kadet Ltd which is his second, and he is going to use it for buying more stocks of potatoes to sell to his customers.

His intention is to use the anticipated profits from his expanded business in buying more stocks of potatoes and he hopes that in future, he is going to be able to open his own store where he will stock potatoes for wholesale.

loans.use: To buy potatoes from farmers and later sell at the local market

loans.name: Capistrana

texts.en:
Capistrana is 35 years old from the community of Talibon, Bohol. She is married with three children ages 5, 7 and 13. Her husband works in the government. 

She is also engaged in farming rice and attending to her Sari-sari (variety)store business to help augment the income of their household. Her business started 8 years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, seedlings, pay for labor, buy canned goods, soft drink and rice.   

In the future, she hopes to expand her business and increase business profitability for her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seedlings, pay for labor, buy canned goods, soft drinks and rice

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 54 year old single mother and supports one child.

She has a business of selling vegetables in Naivasha which she has operated for eighteen years and has applied for first loan from Kadet ltd to enable her buy stock of vegetables such as tomatoes for re-sale. With anticipated profit she plans to pay school fees for her child as well as expand her business.

In the near future, she hopes to open a kiosk where she will be running her business.

loans.use: To buy stock of vegetables such as tomatoes

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is asking for a new loan because she believes that through it she will improve her business.

The previous loan enabled her to to save money to operate a coconut selling business. However, she still operates the retail shop. She is requesting for a loan of ksh.50,000 to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale.

She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 25 years old and is from Nyahururu. He is married, and his spouse is a housewife. He has one child, aged 2 years.

He sells potatoes at the local market, a business he has been running for the past three years.  To enable him to buy more stock of potatoes, he has applied for his second loan of Kshs. 20,000 from Kadet Ltd.

His monthly income right now is Kshs. 6,000.   His hope and dream for his future business and for his family is that he will be an established businessman in the whole of Nyahururu.

loans.use: To buy more stock of potatoes for sale

loans.name: Naveeda

texts.en: Naveeda is a 39-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the last four months. She offers various goods for daily use. She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. Her business is good enough for her to lead a decent life. She is a mother of two children and is motivated to provide for her family. As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of Rs 30,000 to buy stock of rice and flour from the market at lower rates. She then would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She is expecting boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice and flour.

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en: Belinda is a resident of Caldwell.  She is married and has five children, all of whom are adults who are working.  For the past three years, Belinda has been selling dried goods such as rice, peanuts, copy-books, candles and diapers.  She started this business by selling cookies and bread. One thing she enjoys is that she is relaxed and her business is going fast.   She is requesting a loan to purchase rice, peanuts, copy-books, candles and diapers for her business.  She plans to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase rice, peanuts, copy-books, candles and diapers for her business,

loans.name: Arnold

texts.en:
Arnold is 22 years old and a young father of two children, ages two months and a two years. He is a responsible father and husband who provides for his family through hog raising. This has been his business for a year now. He is asking for a loan to buy feed for his hogs. 

Arnold has big plans, like expanding his business someday and making a big piggery.  He is motivated to do this so that his children can have a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy feed

loans.name: Eli

texts.en:
Eli is 27 years old and from Nyahururu. He is not married, but he supports his parents. He is a farmer, as well as a trader of farm produce, a business he has been running for the past four years.

Eli has applied for his second loan of Kshs. 20,000 from Kadet Ltd which he hopes to use to buy sacks to transport farm produce, like potatoes, to the market.  The remaining money will be used for hiring laborers.

Eli's hopes and dreams for the future are to be a great farmer in his area, and to be the main supplier of farm produce in his village.

loans.use: To buy sacks to help transport farm produce to the market, and to hire laborers

loans.name: Brigitta

texts.en: Brigitta appreciates her previous Kiva loan, which improved her living standards and enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She is requesting a loan of KES 50,000 to purchase chicks and chicken feeds. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and chicken feeds

loans.name: Riaz

texts.en: Riaz is a 43-year-old married woman. She is a vigorous lady and, for the past five years, has been running a business selling cloth. Riaz buys cloths of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. Riaz is requesting a loan of Rs. 25,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory.  Riaz expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and she plans to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloths in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en: Naseem is a 35-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the last two years. She offers various goods for daily use. She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. Her husband is also helping her by purchasing things from market. She is a mother of six children and is motivated to provide for her family. As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of Rs 35,000 to buy stock of rice, grains and flour from the market at lower rates. She then would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She wishes to utilize part of revenues to deal with personal expenses and to increase business capital.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice, grains and flour.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is married and has five children, all of whom go to school. She lives in her own house that has no electricity or piped water.

Esther has operated a coconut selling business for the past three years, selling from home to her neighbors and passerby. She cites seasonality as her major challenge.

With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase two sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two sacks of coconuts for resale

loans.name: Perveen

texts.en: Perveen is a 49-year-old married woman who has three children.  For about eight years she is been doing hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. To help her to continue her operations, she has requested for a loan of Rs. 25,000 to buy reels of threads in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for its embellishment. In this way, she will be able to cater to more customers consistently. She is hopeful to get an increase in her income by targeting more customers. She dreams for her children's bright and prosperous future.

loans.use: to buy reels of threads in different colors along with the packs of beads, sequins and stones.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en: Samson is gratefull for the first loan he received from Kiva. He bought a planing machine with the loan and his work improved. The extra income he used to pay school fees for his children. He is seeking another loan to buy 2x2 pieces pieces of timber, 15 feet each, for his business. The challenge in the business is raising capital but he is grateful to Kiva for helping him out. In the next five years he wants to buy a piece of land and build a residential home for his family.

loans.use: to buy 2x2 pieces pieces of timber, 15 feet each

loans.name: Magaret

texts.en:
Magaret is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past three years, Magaret has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 20,000 loan, Magaret wants to purchase bread, wheat flour, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil for resale. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bread, wheat flour, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil for resale.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecelia is a 30-year-old married woman and a mother of three children ages two, three and a month old baby. They live in Talibon, Bohol. Cecelia has been in the hog raising business for a few years now. She is asking for a loan to buy a piglet, feed to maintain her hogs, nails and hard wood to renovate her house. In the future, Cecelia only dreams for the best of her children specially for them to have a good education through her hard work and the success of her business.

loans.use: to buy piglet, feed, nails and hard wood

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is 31 years old, married to Mary, and supports a family of six.  His children are aged between twenty-six and seven years of age. He is a mixed farmer and has been in the business for the last six years. His monthly income is KES 8000.

Jackson is currently servicing his 3rd loan from KADET of KES 30,000, which will help him to prepare his land and seedlings planted. He plans to use the anticipated profits to diversify into livestock farming. His dream is to improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to prepare land and buy farm inputs

loans.name: Aysha

texts.en: Aysha is a 42-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband (who is also shown in the picture) at the corner of her house. They have been running it together for many years. Her husband also assists her by purchasing goods from the market, as he has maintained many contacts over the years. Aysha is a mother of three children, and she is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of PKR 20,000 to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Misbah

texts.en:
Misbah is a 39-year-old married woman. She has been in the business of making footballs for ten years. Her husband is a mason and does not earn enough money so she started her business to support her family. She stitches balls in different sizes and sells them in her community and in the local market. She is famous in her town for providing good quality footballs. She earns enough to bear the expenses of her family members. 

For the improvement of her business, she contacted a Kashf Foundation business development officer for a loan of 30,000 Rs. (Pakistan rupees). The amount will be used to purchase rubber bladders and leather covers in a large quantity to cater to more customers without delay. She is in her 3rd loan cycle with good repayment history. She is hopeful to get an expansion in her business, which ultimately help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase rubber bladders and leather covers in a large quantity.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina is a 34-year-old married woman and is a mother of four children. She is motivated to provide all facilities of life to her family. Two years ago, she started her a small general store in her community.  She offers various goods such as hair accessories, creams and lotions, reels of threads etc. She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. Over the time she has become popular in her community for providing good quality products and makes enough to meet the expenses of her children. 

Currently, she requested a loan of Rs. 20,000 to buy packs of hair ponies and clips along with the stock of powder and lotions to meet with the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of hair ponies and clips along with the stock of powder and lotions.

loans.name: Ishrat

texts.en: Ishrat, 50 years old, is a very enthusiastic person who has been successfully running a shop keeping business for many years. She offers a variety of daily use products and has a good client base. In order to avoid shortages, Ishrat needs to have various goods in stock to efficiently meet customer demand. Ishrat has requested a loan of PKR 20,000 to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc.  In this way, she will be able to consistently meet the increasing demand at her store and make better earnings.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc.

loans.name: Najma

texts.en: Najma is a 36-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. She has successfully run a small general store in her community with the support of her husband.  She offers various goods for daily use. She makes enough to provide for her family. To make her store fully stocked, she requested a loan of Rs 20,000, which she will use to buy a stock of rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way, she will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital. She is in her 3rd loan cycle with good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy a stock of rice, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.en:
Claudia is 54 years old, from Getafe, Bohol. She is married with three adult children.

For 15 years now, Claudia has been selling fish, while her husband work as a policeman.

Claudia is asking for a loan to buy more fish to sell and to buy a new weighing scale. This will help, so she can have a good sale, with the help of additional capital. She would like to continue saving for old age, so she will not have to depend on her children.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell and to buy a weighing scale.

loans.name: Lim's Group

texts.en: Lim is a 49-year-old father of eight children, only one of whom is still in school. To make a living, he has been farming rice and cassava as his main sources of the family’s income. Lim has been with Kiva’s partner VisionFund for one cycle. With his current business, he is able to earn about 41,700 KHR per day to spend on daily expenses. Now he leads a group consisting of three members to request a loan from VisionFund. He will use his portion to buy fertilizer for his crops. With this loan, he hopes to grow more rice and cassava to increase his family’s income so as to improve their lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 34 years old and married to John.  They have two children, who are in school.

She has a retail shop in Naivasha that she has operated for five years.  She has applied for her first loan from Kadet Ltd to enable her to buy more stock, such as sugar, rice, and flour, among other items. 

With the anticipated profit, Nancy plans to pay school fees and expand her business.  In the near future, she hopes to own a wholesale shop in the Boma area.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, and flour, among other items.

loans.name: Sambou's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village of Kandal province’s Ponhea Leur district, Sambou is aged 34 years and widowed. She has three children to take care of, and all of them are dependents and still in school. To feed her family, she has worked hard as a rice farmer for three years. She currently earns about 15,000 KHR per day. 

Sambou is the first cycled client with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan of 175,000 KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy materials for constructing a proper latrine. She hopes to have a healthy latrine for her family to use.

loans.use: to buy materials for constructing a proper latrine

loans.name: Vitoria

texts.pt:
Vitoria nasceu na província de Inhambane, no Sul de Moçambique. Tem 29 anos, vive maritalmente na casa própria com a sua família, e é mãe de 4 filhos somente 2 é que vão a escola. Não responsabiliza-se  por ninguem.
É funcionária da empresa Beluzi Bananas (como agricultora) e aufere um valor que aplica nas despesas da casa e da sua obra. está a construir uma casa para si e para sua familia. com o presente  empréstimo pretende para aumentar bens da casa, comprando uma cristaleira. Este é o seu 2º empréstimo na Hluvuku para compra de bens o anterior foi para habitação.
 Futuramente pretende ver sua casa mobiliada e dar mais conforto a sua familia e por fim adquirir uma viatura.
texts.en:
Vitoria comes from the province of Inhambane, southern Mozambique. She's 29 years old and married. She lives with her family in a house that she owns. She has four children, only two of whom attend school. She doesn't have anybody under her responsibility.
She works for a banana company named Beluzi (as a farmer) and earns an income that she uses to pay for her household and construction expenses. She's building a house for herself and her family. With the current loan she intends to add to her household items by purchasing a china cabinet. This is her second loan with Huluvuku for personal purchases. The previous loan was for housing expenses.
In the future she intends to have her house furnished, provide more comfort for her family and finally, acquire a vehicle.

loans.use: to add to her household items by purchasing a china cabinet.

loans.name: Cremildo

texts.pt:
Cremildo nasceu na Província de Inhambane, no Sul de Moçambique. Tem 27 anos, vive na casa dos pais com a sua família e é pai de 2 filhos menores. Responsabiliza-se pelos 2 irmãos que vive na mesma casa.
É funcionário da Educação (é professor) e aufere um valor que aplica nas despesas da casa e da sua obra, pois está a construir uma casa para si e para a sua família. Mas como o custo de vida que eleva-se a cada dia que passa, ele solicitou um empréstimo para concluir as minimas partes da sua obra comprando chapas de zinco, barrotes, varoes e mais. Este é já o seu 2º empréstimo na Hluvuku, e o anterior foi também para habitação.
 Futuramente pretende concluir o empréstimo e mudar se para a sua propria casa. o seu maior desafio e continuar com a sua carreira estudantil.
texts.en:
Cremildo comes from the province of Inhambane, southern Mozambique. He's 27 years old and lives with his family in his parents' house. He has two underage children and he's responsible for his two brothers who live in the same house.
He's an education worker (a teacher) and earns an income which he uses to pay for his household and construction expenses. He's currently building a house for himself and his family. However, since the cost of living is rising everyday, he requested a loan so he can finish the basic parts of his construction work by purchasing metal sheets, beams, rods, etc. This is his second loan with Hluvuku already, and the previous loan was also for housing expenses.
In the future he intends to finish repaying the loan and move into his house. His main challenge is moving forward with his education.

loans.use: to finish the basic parts of his construction work by purchasing metal sheets, beams, rods, etc.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Namaacha de 48 anos vive maritalmente na casa própria, é pai de 7 filhos todos vão a Escola. Não responsabiliza se por ninguem.
Alberto Trabalha na área da Educação ha mais de 29 anos, aufere um valor que aplica nas dispesas da casa e da obra, optou em solicitar este crédito para reforçar o negócio para sua esposa adquirindo: farinha, arroz. Peixe, massas, ovos e outros, na tentativa de aumentar a renda familiar, uma vez que trabalha longe da familia.
Futuramente pretende ampliar seu estabelecimento comercial. Esta confiante que ira pagar antes do tempo para aceder mais créditos.
texts.en:
Alberto comes from the district of Namaacha. He's 48 years old and married, and he lives in a house that he owns. He has seven children, all of whom attend school. He doesn't have anyone under his responsibility.
Alberto has worked in education for over 29 years. He earns an income which he uses to pay for his household and construction expenses. He opted to request this loan so he can boost his wife's business by purchasing flour, rice, fish, noodles, eggs, etc. That way he'll try and increase his family's income, since he works far away from his family.
In the future he intends to enlarge his store. He's confident that he'll repay the loan ahead of schedule so he can apply for more loans.

loans.use: to boost his wife's business by purchasing flour, rice, fish, noodles, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Eseta

texts.en: Eseta is a 27 year old married woman with 3 children. She makes and sells rice and curry in her community to earn a living. She has 2 years of experience with this business. Eseta needs a loan to buy bags of rice, chicken, curry powder, onions and garlic onion. She plans to use her profits to improve her business so that she can be able to support her family. Eseta has been a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice, chicken, curry powder, onions and garlic onion

loans.name: Murtada

texts.en:
Murtada is a married youth client from Iraq, who is 27 years old and has one child. 

Murtada is the sole provider of his family and works hard to provide his family with all the profits he gains from his shop, where he specializes in selling spare parts for motorcycles. He not only sells, but also repairs them. He has been in this field for ten years and, in 2007, established his own independent business. Murtada now has a hired employee, is well-known in the market, and has gained the respect of his neighborhood.

Murtada is applying for a youth loan of USD 3,000, which he will use to pay the annual rent of his shop and to increase his inventories for sale. He believes that this loan will give him the opportunity to increase his profits and will grant him the ability to take better care of his family.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent of his shop and to increase his inventories for sale.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is requesting for a loan as added capital in her food snacks selling business. It will help her buy ready to sell glutinous food snacks that she retails around their village for an income. She only earns an average net income of PHP1,000 from mere selling foods and this was subdivided into savings, house expenditures and other bills needed to pay. 

She got married at an early age. Now she has three children, her eldest already attends school. Her husband served as farm laborer in their place. She is now 29 years old and is hoping to keep generating good income from selling. Someday, she dreams of living a prosperous life with her family.

loans.use: to buy ready to sell glutinous food snacks that she retails around their village for an income.

loans.name: Fouras

texts.en:
Fouras, a 31-year-old married father of two, from Iraq, is his family's sole provider. 

Fouras owns a small shop selling fresh chicken, an enterprise he established in 2000. He now has one employee. He has achieved good experience in this field and is well-known in the surrounding area, enjoying an excellent reputation. 

Fouras is requesting a USD 3,000 loan to pay the annual rent of his shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase profits in order to provide his children with better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent of his shop.

loans.name: Mary Adoyo

texts.en:
Mary is a 42-year-old single mother of two children who are in school.

She has a business of selling fish in Naivasha. She has operated the business for five years. She has applied for her first loan from Kadet Ltd. to enable her to buy stock of fish for sale. She plans to pay school fees with the anticipated profit.

She hopes to own a kiosk in the near future, so as to have a stable business.

loans.use: to buy fish for sale.

loans.name: Dúo Flor De Trigo Group

texts.es: Duo Flor de trigo, este grupo esta conformado por la señora Hercilia de 51 años de edad,se ha dedicado a la venta de consumo diario ha tenido su negocio desde hace mucho tiempo, esta muy agradecida por la ayuda que la han brindado ustedes por medio de los credito, su negocio gracias a Dios dia con dia ba creciendo, en esta ocacion esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mas mercaderia para la venta productos de consumo diario,Aroz, Frijol,Aceite, Maiz, etc.Esperando que ustedes(Kiva)nuevamente la puedan ayudar ya que su sueño es tener un negocio mas grande que el que actualmente tiene, Gracias por su ayuda que Dios les bendiga donde quiera que se encuentren.
texts.en:
The Duo Flor de Trigo group is comprised of Hercilia, 51. She works by selling daily use products and she has been in this business for a long time. She is very grateful for the help you all provide through loans. Thanks to God, her business is growing each day.

She is currently requesting this loan to buy more merchandise to sell (daily use products like rice, beans, oil, corn, etc.). She hopes that you (Kiva) can help her again because her dream is to have a larger business than she currently has. Thank you for your help, may God bless you wherever you are.

loans.use: to buy daily use products like rice, beans, oil, corn, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy items like soaps, sugar, salt and many other retail goods

loans.name: Ketevan

texts.en:
Ketevan is a 38-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband and five children in a small village of Martvili district. Her husband is a physical worker and gets 300 Gel per month. 

Ketevan is actively involved in agricultural activities. She has a pig and sells piglets. She also has land where maize and nut trees are grown. She is a very hardworking woman and always has high-quality products which are sold to local retailers. 

Ketevan decided to start a dairy business and requested a loan. The Start-Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, gives her a chance to get a loan of 1,800 Gel and purchase a cow. She will start producing dairy products to sell. 

The Start-Up program enables her to generate more income and improve the living conditions for her five children.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet 34-year-old Fatmata, from Rokupr, a northern area in Sierra Leone. She is married with three children between the ages of 8 years and 18 years. Her children are currently attending school. 

For the past ten years, Fatmata has established her cookery business. She began her business because she was trained in business and she thinks it is more profitable. She works at the business 12 hours per day and seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is the price inflation of goods.

Fatmata requires a loan in order to purchase more palm oil, rice, cooking seasoning, and drinks. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her standard of living and pay her children's school fees. 

In the future, Fatmata plans to buy a plot of land. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, rice, cooking seasoning, and drinks.

loans.name: Sosefina

texts.en: Sossefina is a 34 year old single lady with no children. She makes and sells rice and fried chicken in her community to earn a living. She has 2 years of experience with this business.Sosefina needs a loan to buy bags of rice, boxes of chicken, dripping oil, foam plates, and glad wrap. She plans to use her profits to improve her business and to support her family. Sosefina has been a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice, boxes of chicken, dripping oil, foam plates, and glad wrap.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en: Estrella is a 47-year-old woman living in Talibon, Bohol. She is married with six children. Saturnina has owned a Sari-sari (variety) store business for twenty years now where she sells coffee, detergent, shampoo, cooking oil and eggs. Her husband also work as a Technician. She is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy rice and soft drinks. She hopes to improve her store inventory and hopefully make it bigger someday for a good savings.

loans.use: to buy rice and soft drinks

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is 22 years old and lives in Kakata, the capital City of Margibi County, which has the highest production of rubber plantations in Liberia. She is unmarried with two children age 5 and 9; they are in school and live at home. She was unable to complete 4th grade. 

For four years now, she has been running a cook shop in the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her fiancee and learned this trade from her friends. She spends eight hours each day on her business. Mostly she uses a taxi to get her goods to her market table.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more red oil, meat, fish, peppers, vita, etc., for her business. She hopes to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more red oil, meat, fish, peppers, vita, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Tomas Felix

texts.pt:
Tomás de32 anos é técnico electrónico ha 11 anos e trabalha a conta propria, casado e pai de 5 filhos e vive na casa de seus pais.
O dinheiro deste empréstimo sera aplicado na compra de cantoneiras, tubos, cimento, loiça sanitária para dar continuidade a construção da sua casa.
No futuro pretende construir um estabelecimento onde possa trabalhar em boas condições e vender acessórios de telefones, neste momento trabalha ao ar livre.
Trabalhar mais e economizar os rendimentos fazer melhor os pagamentos do emprestimo  em curso.
texts.en:
Tomás is 32 years old. He has been an electronics technician for 11 years and he's self-employed. He's married and has five children, and he lives in his parents' house.
The money from this loan will be used to purchase angle brackets, pipes, cement and sanitary ware so he can continue building his house.
In the future he intends to build a store where he can work under good conditions and sell phone accessories. He currently works outdoors.
He also intends to work harder, save his profits and make good on his repayments for the current loan.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (cement, adhesive, toilets and pipes) so he can continue building his house.

loans.name: Sophorn

texts.en: A rural villager in the Kandal Stoeng district, Sophorn is 29 years old and married with two daughters. To make a living, she has been farming rice as a main source of income. To gains extra income, she is a hair dresser while her husband is a truck driver. She has been in this business for five years. This is the first loan for Sophorn with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. She is now applying for a loan of 4,000,000KHR with VisionFund to buy fertilizer, insecticide and rice seed for her farming and use some portion to buy the some items for her hair salon. This loan will enable Sophorn to expand her business so as to increase family's income and provide a good education to her children.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, insecticide and rice seed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more items like sugar, books, and many other items.

loans.name: Jendelyn

texts.en:
Jendelyn is 34 years old and married, with four children, ages 8 to 16. She is from Talibon, Bohol. 

For many years, Jendelyn has been in the fishing business. Jendelyn is requesting a loan to pay for boat maintenance and school fees. 

She is confident that her loan will have a good impact on her business. In the future, Jendelyn hopes to be successful in sending her children to school.

loans.use: to pay for boat maintenance and school fees

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
This is 33-year-old Mariatu. She is single and has one child, age five. 

In 2003, Mariatu established her salon business. She began her business because, when there was no one to pay her school fees, she was trained as a hairdresser. Working seven days a week and 14 hours a day, she earns about SLL 200,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000. Mariatu requires a loan in order to purchase more synthetic hair and cosmetics for resale. 

In the future, Mariatu plans to educate her daughter up to university level. Mariatu is very hard-working. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more synthetic hair and cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Sok Hour

texts.en:
Sok Hour dreams of becoming an Engineer. Sok Hour is going to attend the university of engineering next month. He expects to graduate in 2018, but without a loan, he is unsure how he will be able to continue to afford his education. 

Currently, Sok Hour is employed in the government military. With his current salary, he cannot support his study. Therefore, Sok Hour requests a loan of $5,535 to pay for his five years tuition fee, while his current salary is used for his daily expenses and study materials. With the degree, he hopes that he will get a high paying job.

loans.use: to pay for his five years tuition fee.

loans.name: Marina Del Carmen

texts.es: Marina de 48 años de edad, vive muy feliz en casa propia es una mujer muy trabajadora que vela por si misma y su esposo. Por como la admiran sus vecinos exclaman de ella que es responsable y muy carismática. Actualmente trabaja en el mercado vendiendo frutas y verduras poco a poco pagando los gastos del hogar. Ella ha tomando la decisión de adquirir un préstamo a FUSAI ya que no tiene el dinero suficiente y desea comprar materiales de construcción porque desea cambiar el techo y para ello necesita comprar laminas nueva, clavos entre otros. Actualmente el techo está muy deteriorado y en esta época de lluvia les está siendo difícil convivir es dicho espacio. Por lo que espera pronto solventar este problema de su vivienda.
texts.en: Marina, 48, lives happily in her own home.  She is a hardworking woman who takes good care of herself and her husband.  Admired by her neighbors, she is known for being responsible and very charming.  She currently works in the market selling fruits and vegetables so that little by little she can pay for the household expenses.  She decided to take a loan with FUSAI because she did not have enough money, and she wants to buy construction materials to put a new roof on her house.  To do this, she needs to buy new sheets of laminated metal, nails, and other materials.  The roof she has now is very dilapidated, and in this rainy season they are finding it difficult to live in this condition.  Therefore, she hopes to quickly resolve this problem with her house.

loans.use: to buy building materials to repair her roof

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La cliente es de la ciudad de Durán.  Desde hace mucho tiempo atrás le ha gustado la costura, dado que pudo realizar un curso donde aprendió a coser ropa.  Después de esto invirtió en una máquina de coser y estableció su taller.  Trabaja sola desde las 9 am hasta las 10 pm.  Es divorciada y tiene hijos, pero ya son mayores de edad.  Ahora necesita el crédito para la compra de una máquina de coser.
texts.en: This borrower is from the city of Duran.  For quite some time she has enjoyed sewing, since she was able to take a class where she learned to sew clothing.  After this, she invested in a sewing machine and set up her own workshop.  She works alone from 9am until 10pm.  She is divorced and has children, but they are all grown.  At this time, she needs a loan to buy a sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Maria   Estela

texts.pt:
Maria é casda e  mãe de 4 filhos que frequentam o nίvel básico e secundário, vive na casa própria e é agente de serviços numa escola técnica onde trabalha.
O emprestimo será usado na compra de cimento, varrões, tijoleiras, areia, pedra  e chapas de zinco para ampliar sua casa.
Tem como planos para o futuro oficializar o casamento e terminar a ampliacao de sua casa.( cozinha, casa de banho).
Diz ainda que compromete se a pagar pontualmente e voltar a solicitar mais empréstimos para concretizar seus planos.
texts.en:
Maria is married and has four children who attend elementary and high school. She lives in a house that she owns. She's a service agent for a technical school where she works.
The loan will be used to purchase cement, rods, tiles, sand, rocks and metal sheets so she can enlarge her house.
Her plans for the future are to make her marriage official and finish enlarging her house (with a kitchen and a bathroom).
She also states that she pledges to repay the loan in a timely fashion and request more loans again so she can achieve her plans.

loans.use: to purchase cement, rods, tiles, sand, rocks and metal sheets.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 49 years old and married, the mother of three children, ages 11 to 20. She is from Getafe, Bohol. 

Togerher with her husband, Josephine has engaged in the rice milling business for 10 years now. 

Josephine is asking for a loan to buy food for family consumption and pay tuition fees for her children.

In the future, she hopes of expanding her business to increase its profitability. She also wants to be successful in sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy food for family consumption and pay tuition fees

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: María Isabel de 38 años de edad, habita junto a su familia, su esposo y sus hijos. Es una mujer muy trabajadora que siempre se ha destacado por ser emprendedora. Actualmente su forma de ganarse la vida es vendiendo pupusas y pasteles en su casa (platos típicos del país), todas la tardes pone su venta y gracias a Dios vende lo necesario para los gastos del día. Ella ha ido mejorando su hogar poco a poco y le falta por hacer pero no tiene el recurso monetario suficiente es por esa razón que solicitó a FUSAI un préstamo que le permita comprar materiales de construcción como cemento y arena ya que el piso es de tierra, y laminas galvanizada para mejorar el techo de un cuarto. Confían en saldar la deuda y mejorar lo antes pensionado.
texts.en: María Isabel is 38 years old, lives with her family - her husband and children. She is a very hard-working woman who always has stood out as being entrepreneurial. Today she earns a living selling pupusas and pasteles (traditional dishes in her country) from her home. She sells every afternoon and thanks be to God she sells what she needs to sell to meet her daily needs. She has improved her home little by little and she still has more to do but doesn't have sufficient monetary resources so therefore she asked FUSAI for a loan that will enable her to buy construction materials such as cement and sand as her floor is earthen, and galvanized laminate to improve the roof of her room. she is confident to pay off the loan and make improvements.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as cement for her earthen floor and laminate to improve her roof.

loans.name: Sonko Suwa Warmisita Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SONKO SUWA WARMISITA”  iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Ángela es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: costura de chamarras, venta de carne de cordero, tienda de barrio, atención de internet, venta de comida, bordado de chompas de alpaca, atención de snack.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Ángela es integrante, ella indica que hace un ciclo que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio; este negocio lo emprendió al observar la necesidad que tenían sus vecinos de contar con un espacio de compra, es por ella decide establecer el mismo. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de arroz, fideo, aceite) que adquirirá de las distribuidoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Sonko Suwa Warmisita" will start its second loan cycle in the Panamericana offices of Pro Mujer.  This group has 8 members, and is led by a board of directors where Angela is the treasurer.  The members of this communal bank have a variety of businesses including: sewing jackets, selling lamb meat, running a neighborhood store, running an internet cafe, selling food, embroidering alpaca sweaters, and snack bar.

The loan that they are taking will benefit this group of small businesswomen, of which Angela is a member.  She states that she joined Pro Mujer one loan cycle ago at the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution.  Anglela currently has a neighborhood store, which she started up after seeing that her neighbors needed to have a place to shop.  This is the reason that she established her store.

The loan that she is now taking will be used to increase her capital (to purchase rice, noodles and cooking oil).  She will acquire these items from the wholesale distributors in the city of El Alto, and later sell them from her store.  By working this way, she can generate resources to support her family, as she is married and has 3 children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answered that she likes the health and credit training.

loans.use: to buy rice, noodles and cooking oil

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.es:
Doña Rosenda tiene 50 años de edad es agricultora y ama de casa, madre de 8 hijos los cuales ayudan con las diferentes tareas a realizar en el campo en compañía de sus padres. Su especialidad es el cultivo y siembra de café ya que en la comunidad y en su familia es un rubro que predomina sin importar la competencia ya que los intermediarios y demás compradores tienen preferencias. Ella no tiene ningún grado de escolaridad ya sus padres no pudieron apoyarla para que ella pudiese estudiar por la falta de recursos económicos. Fueron sus padres los que le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra ya que ellos son agricultores y las tierras que trabajan son propias las cuales están ubicadas a una distancia de 10 minutos de camino.
Ella ve la necesidad de darle mantenimiento y asistencia a sus cultivos de café por lo que ha solicitado a la cooperativa COMIXMUL un financiamiento para la compra de insumos agrícolas como: fertilizantes, abono, urea, formula cafetalera, etc. 
Sus planes a futuro son los de extender sus cultivos y comprar más tierra para sembrar una mejor variedad de café como: caturra, lempira, que son competitivos en el mercado. Sus sueños como madre es poder darle una educación completa a su hija y que sea mejor cada día que pasa.
texts.en:
Rosenda is 50 years old, and is a farmer and homemaker. She is the mother of eight children, who help their parents with different tasks in the fields. Rosenda's specialty is the planting and cultivation of coffee. This is the predominant occupation in the community and in her family, regardless of the competition, since the local middlemen and other buyers have their preferences. 

Rosenda was not able to complete any schooling, as her parents were unable to support her in studying due to their lack of financial resources. It was her parents who taught her to work the soil, as they are also farmers and work their own land, located about ten minutes away.

She sees that it is necessary to maintain and improve her coffee crops, and she has therefore sought a loan from the COMIXMUL cooperative in order to buy agricultural inputs such as fertilizers, manure, and urea, including a specific "coffee formula" fertilizer. Her plans for the future are to extend her crops and buy more land in order to plant a greater range of coffees, including the Caturra and Lempira varieties, which are competitive in the marketplace. Her dreams as a mother are to be able to give a full education to her daughter and to do better for her family with every day that passes.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs to maintain and improve her coffee crops.

loans.name: Fredesvindo

texts.es: Fredesvindo de 49 años de edad, habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su familia su esposa y tres hijos de 19 años, 24 años 26 años de edad. Es un hombre muy visionari0 que le gusta desempeñarse y ganarse la vida honradamente. Se dedica a la labor de vender pan francés y tamales (masa de maiz relleno de carne de pollo), Desde que se levanta trata de dejar todo listo y necesario para ya en la tarde tener lista su venta. Siempre con deseos de mejorar su vivienda se acercó a FUSAI para la compra de lámina galvanizada, pines, polines y otros materiales de construcción con el fin de reparar el techo de su humilde vivienda pues la que tienen está muy deteriorada y picada por el humo de la cocina, además las lluvias ya han comenzado a afectarles filtrándose el agua y está arruinando sus pocas pertenencias
texts.en: Fredesvindo is 49 years old, lives in his own house along with his family - his wife and three children ages 19, 24, and 26 years of age. He is a man of vision and he likes to work hard and earn a living honorably. He sells French bread and tamales (a corn masa filled with chicken). From the  moment he gets up he tries to have everything that's needed ready for his afternoon sales. He has always had dreams of improving his home so he approached FUSAI in order to buy the galvanized laminate, pins, and other construction materials with the goal of repairing the roof of his humble home as it is very deteriorated and pierced from the smoke of his kitchen. In addition the rains have begun to affect them, filtering through the roof and ruining his few belongings.

loans.use: to buy galvanized laminate, pins, and other construction materials to repair the roof of his humble home.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es: Concepción de 49 años de edad, habita junto a su familia en casa de su propiedad desde hace ya 7 años. Es una mujer muy trabajadora y visionaria que siempre cumple lo que se propone. Su forma de ganarse la vida es vendiendo ropa usada y nueva, gracias a Dios se ha hecho de clientes que la prefieren por dar precios bajos y accesibles. Poco a poco y como ha podido ha ido mejorar su hogar y desea repellar las paredes de adobe y no tiene pero no cuenta con los recursos monetarios para realizarlo. Es por eso que solicita a FUSAI un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción cemento, arena. Confía en poder tener su casa mejorada y darle un buen techo a su familia
texts.en: Concepción is 49 years old and has lived with her family in their own house for 7 years. She is a very hard-working and visionary woman who always completes that which she starts. She sells new and used clothing. Thanks be to God she has gained customers that prefer her for her low and accessible prices. Little by little she has been able to improve her home and she wishes to stucco the adobe walls and she doesn't have the monetary resources to do so. Therefore she asked FUSAI for a loan to buy construction materials such as cement and sand. She is confident in being able to have her house improved and provide a good roof to her family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials including cement, sand, and stucco for her walls.

loans.name: Johnsthan

texts.en: Johnsthan is a 53-year-old married man.  He has been running a food café in Mshomoroni, Mombasa for the last six years. He is a KADET LTD client and this marks his fourth loan to finance his business. With this loan, he plans to uplift his business by purchasing assorted foodstuffs such as maize, wheat flour, cooking oil and sugar for his café. The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to plough back into the café business. He has been happy with his business as he is able to sustain his family needs through the café.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs for his café

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 33 years old and married to Esther. They have three children who are in school.

He has a cereal shop in Naivasha which he has operated for eleven years  and he has applied for his first loan from KADET to enable him buy a stock of maize and beans for resale. With the anticipated profit he plans to pay school fees.

He hopes to expand his business and improve the living standards of his family In the near future.

loans.use: To buy maize and beans to sell in his shop.

loans.name: Mervic

texts.en:
Mervic is a 27-year-old woman from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is married with one son who is 9 years old. Mervic is engaged in fishing together with her husband. She is asking for a loan to pay for boat repair and pay for school fees for her son. 

Mervic is confident that as long as they work hard, they will be able to uplift their present living condition. 

In the future, she hopes to expand her business and increase business profitability for her child’s education.

loans.use: to pay for boat repair and pay for school fees for her son.

loans.name: Denis

texts.en: Denis is a hard-working young man who supports his elderly parents. He is 23 years old and operates a motorcycle transport business that earns him KES 15,000 per month. He learned about KADET from fellow riders who have already been funded by KADET ltd. He has need of a first loan of KES 78,504 which will enable him to purchase his own motorcycle. This way he will earn more income as his client base grows. He will use the proceeds to repay the loan and meet his basic needs. His dream is to be successful in life.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is 29 years old and from Nyahururu.  He is single, but he supports his parents and his siblings.

He has a business of growing and selling foodstuffs like potatoes, which he has been running for the past seven years. To enable him to buy more stocks of potatoes, he has applied for his third loan of KES 20,000 from Kadet Ltd.

His monthly income right now is KES 8,000.  The anticipated profits from his expanded business will be used in buying and expanding his business to ensure that all his customers have been supplied with this commodity, the demand for which is ever increasing.

Jackson's hopes and dreams for the future are to be a successful businessman.

loans.use: To buy more potatoes from farmers in bulk and sell them at retail

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a man of thirty-five years, married and a father of two children. He operates a grocery store and also sells charcoal in Narariga on the outskirts of Limuru town. He gets a monthly income of eleven thousand shillings.

This will be John's first loan with KADET LTD. He plans to use the entire amount to buy groceries and charcoal for selling. 

In the future, he wants to own rental houses.

loans.use: to buy charcoal, cabbages, etc.

loans.name: Rahab

texts.en: Rahab is 37 years old, married and blessed with two children aged 8 and 3. She sells clothes and she has been in business for five years. Right now her monthly income is KES 18,000. Rahab is taking a loan of KES 70,000 which she intends to use to add stock to her business. She plans to buy a plot of land with the anticipated profits and build a permanent house.This is her 3rd loan and she successfully paid her previous loans.

loans.use: To add more stock to her business

loans.name: Absalom

texts.en: Absalom is a 36 year old married businessman in Mombasa, Kenya. He sells second hand clothes through a business that he has been involved in for twelve years and is doing well. This marks Absalom's third loan from KADET to finance his business. He plans to restock his business by purchasing more second hand clothes for resale. Absalom will use the anticipated profits to repay his loan and also to sustain his daily family needs. He hopes to venture deeper in his clothes selling business and expand even more.

loans.use: to purchase more second hand clothes for resale

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is 32 years old, married to Noonkipa and a father of three children, aged 7, 4 and 8 months respectively. He has been a potato farmer in Mau Narok area for the last six years, getting a monthly income of KES 15,000. 

With a fifth loan of KES 80,000 from KADET, he intends to acquire farm inputs for better yields. Thomas will use part of the funds to clear the land lease fee.

He plans to use the anticipated profits to increase his farm acreage. His dream is to have a sustainable business.

loans.use: to pay for land lease and purchase inputs.

loans.name: Ramonita

texts.en:
Ramonita is 52 years old and from the municipality of Talibon, Bohol. She is married with four dependents, ages 11-19. Ramonita works hard as a partner to her husband in maintaining their fishing business. 

She is asking for a loan to buy gasoline for their boat and pay for school fees of her children. She knows how the loan will let them stay afloat while keeping their business, and keep their children in school.

In the future, she hopes to have a more comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and pay for school fees.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is an old client of Ugafode Microfinance who applied for a loan of UGX 3,000,000. He runs a small shop dealing in ladies’ bags in a nearby trading centre and has been doing this for more than five years. 

The purpose of the loan is to restock his business so that he can increase his earning to maintain his family, pay school fees for his siblings and develop himself. David is an honest and very hardworking man, but is always limited by capital. 

He intends to shift from a smaller room to a bigger room in Mbarara town, where he says turnover and profit margins are higher than where he is currently operating.

loans.use: to buy ladies' bags to sell.

loans.name: Manuelita

texts.es:
Manuelita, de 28 años de edad, está casada con Enos quien es agricultor, con quien tiene 02 hijos de 11 y 4 años de edad  a los que quiere mucho, habitando cómodamente su casa propia. La actividad que realiza Manuelita es la venta de bebidas gaseosas y comidas en su propia casa, con lo cual se ahorra para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio. Cada día se instala en el frontis de su casa para vender sus comidad, logrando tener una buena acogida entres sus clientes. Lleva realizando estas actividad por mas de 06 años. Le gusta su negocio pues le genera los ingresos económicos que necesita para seguir adelante. Este  será su crédito  número 06 con Kiva, por ello solicita de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Se siente agradecido de contar con una línea de crédito para continuar con sus negocios.
Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles los invertirá en la compra de bebidas a precio por mayor de diversos sabores para tener mayores ingresos y además invertir en sus comidas.
texts.en:
Manuelita is 28 years old.  She is married to Enos, a farmer, and they have two children, aged eleven and four years old each.  Manuelita and Enos love their children a lot and they live comfortably in their own house.  Manuelita makes a living selling fizzy drinks and meals out of her house.  She saves up money in order to continue investing in her business.  Every day, Manuelita sets up outside her house to sells her food, and provides a warm welcome to her customers.  Manuelita has been doing this work for over six years.  She likes her business as it gives her the income that she needs to get ahead.  This will be Manuelita's sixth loan with Kiva and she is applying again in order to make her plans become a reality.  Manuelita is grateful to be able to count on a loan in order to continue with her business.

With this loan of 1500 Nuevo Soles, Manuelita will buy drinks of various flavours in bulk in order to have a higher income and to invest more in her meals.

loans.use: to buy drinks for her food stall.

loans.name: Caleb

texts.en:
Caleb is 27, married to Simbili, and a father of two children aged two and a half and seven months respectively. He has been employed in the motorcycle transport business for the last two years with a monthly salary of KES 15,000. He learned about KADET from other riders who are already being funded by KADET Ltd.

Caleb has taken a first loan of KES 78,504 which will enable him to acquire his own motorcycle. This way he is likely to make more income as he has already established a wide customer base. He will use the proceeds to cater to the family's basic needs as well as repay the loan. He hopes to start a shop, buy more motorcycles and create jobs for others.

loans.use: to purchase his own motorbike

loans.name: Miriam Del Socorro

texts.es: Miriam, a sus 47 años de edad se dedica a atender su negocio, una tienda de abarrotes y legumbres que tiene ubicada en su casa, allí ofrece todo tipo de productos de la canasta familiar, frutas y verduras, trabaja sola todos los días y, de esta manera genera los ingresos suficientes para aportar a la economía de su familia que está conformada por sus 3 hijos y su esposo. Ella se caracteriza por ser una mujer pujante, dedicada, trabajadora y le gusta atender bien a sus clientes, ya que de ellos depende la estabilidad de su negocio; por esta razón siempre busca opciones que le permitan mejorar cada día, lo que la lleva a solicitar el apoyo del crédito para realizar unas mejoras locativas y comprar surtido al por mayor (lácteos, huevos, granos, productos de aseo, mecato, carnes frías, gaseosas, frutas y verduras, entre otros productos de la canasta familiar), de esta forma podrá dar una mejor imagen a su negocio y tendrá variedad de productos disponible para ofrecer a sus clientes, con el fin de prestarles un mejor servicio, lo que influye positivamente en su economía, pues podrá aumentar sus ingresos por ventas y seguir luchando para cumplir el sueño de tener un minimercado bien surtido y que sea rentable, para que le permita ofrecer a su familia un mejor nivel de vida y bienestar.
texts.en: Miriam is 47 years old. She works at her business, a grocery and vegetable convenience store located in her house. There she offers all types pf staple products, and fruits and vegetables. She works alone every day and in this way generates enough income to contribute to her family budget. Her family is made up of her three children and her husband. She is described as a driven women who is dedicated, hardworking, and she likes to serve her customers well, because her business' stability depends on them. That is why she always seeks chances to improve every day. That s what has brought her ask for the help of a loan to some some improvements on the locale and buy some merchandise wholesale (dairy, eggs, grains, cleaning products, pastries, cold cuts, sodas, fruits and vegetables, among other staple products). This way, she can give her business a better image and have a variety of products available to offer her customers in order to give them better service. This influences her finances in a positive way because she can increase her income through sales and keep fighting to make her dream of having a well stocked, profitable mini-market to be able to give her family a better quality of life and well being.

loans.use: to do some improvements on the locale and buy some merchandise wholesale (dairy, eggs, grains, cleaning products, pastries, cold cuts, sodas, fruits and vegetables, among other staple products).

loans.name: Francisco Jose

texts.es: Francisco es originario de la ciudad de Boaco. Tiene 46 años de edad, casado padre de 2 hijos. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de productos lácteos desde hace 10 años. Es una persona con deseo de superación, la cual ha trabajado y dedicado su tiempo para hacer crecer su negocio. Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa quienes juntos comercializan los productos en el mercado. Solicita el préstamo para comprar: leche en gran cantidad, sal, pastilla de cuajo entre otros, Con el fin de satisfacer a sus clientes. Estima que el crédito será de beneficio para mejorar su nivel de vida, ya que podrá invertir en su negocio y aumentar sus ingresos. Su plan futuro es comprar terrenos y mejorar la infraestructura de su casa. Su meta próxima es comprar vacas y poner una granja de pollo. Considera que los créditos le han ayudado mucho, se siente satisfecho ya que por sus logros ha podido adquirir activos fijos propios.
texts.en: Francisco is originally from the city of Boaco.  He is 46 years old, married, and a father to two children.
