She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for resale.

loans.name: Jeneba

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 35-year-old Jeneba from Tombo Western rural area in Freetown. She is married to a fisherman and blessed with 3 children between the ages 2 and 12 years. Two of her children attend school. 

Jeneba runs a food business at home.  She sells native rice, palm oil and cooking season. She has been running this business since her wedding. She works at the business throughout the week, from morning to night. Jeneba says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation and insufficient finance to expand her business.

Jeneba has requested a loan in order to buy more cooking item like rice, tomatoes paste and cooking seasonings. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, she plans to renovate her house. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more cooking item like rice, tomatoes paste and seasonings.

loans.name: Mamlakat

texts.ru: Мамлакат живет со своей невесткой и внуком в городе Худжанд. Ее сын на заработках заграницей, а мужа у нее нет. Мамлакат  60 лет. Она у себя дома продает муку. Чтобы продавать свой товар на рынке требуется платить за аренду торговой точки. Клиенты приходят прямо домой к Мамлакат, чтобы приобрести муку. В основном клиенты состоят из соседей и пекарей лепешечных цехов. Мамлакат занимается купле-продажей муки в течение 7 лет и успешно продвигает свой бизнес. Она просит кредит, чтобы закупить побольше мешков муки и увеличить оборот товара. Дополнительно Мамлакат работает в школе, но старается больше времени проводить дома рядом с единственным внуком.
texts.en:
Mamlakat lives with her daughter-in-law and grandson in the city of Khujand. Her son is working abroad, and she does not have a husband. Mamlakat is 60 years old. 

She sells flour from her home; in order to sell her goods at the market, it is necessary to pay rent on a trade stall. Customers come straight to Mamlakat's home to buy flour. For the most part, her customers consist of neighbors and bakers from flatbread shops. Mamlakat has been involved in buying and selling flour for seven years and has successfully promoted her business. 

She is requesting a loan to buy more bags of flour and to increase the circulation of goods. Additionally, Mamlakat works in a school, but is trying to spend more time at home near her only grandson.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour to develop her business

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
Maruja tiene 46 años, es soltera y tiene 1 hijo que vive con ella en su casa hecha con material noble. Maruja se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles en su hogar. Es un negocio que le permite ofrecer a sus clientes diversos víveres de primera necesidad tales como arroz, azúcar, cereales, conservas, bebidas así como insumos que suelen comprarle sus clientes ya que son en su mayoría amas de casa. Comenta que nunca pensó tener un negocio tan rentable que le permitió ponerle mucho empeño. A medida que fueron pasando los años fue complementándolo con la venta de pollo, carne; así como frutas y verduras. Se caracteriza por ser muy amable en cuanto al trato que brinda y siente que eso es lo que hace próspero su negocio.
Trata siempre de comprar su mercadería con mucha anticipación y al por mayor ya que el tener su negocio bien abastecido favorece el incremento de sus ventas. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En esta oportunidad desea contar con 2,000 nuevos soles para compra de productos al por mayor tales como sacos de arroz, azúcar, conservas enlatadas, leche enlatada, frutas y verduras.
texts.en:
Maruja is 46 years old, single and has one child who lives with her in a solidly built house. Maruja sells food products from her house. It is a business where she can offer her customers various basic food supplies like rice, sugar, grains, canned food, drinks as well as other supplies her clients usually buy. The majority of her clients are housewives. 

Maruja comments that she never thought she would own such a profitable business which she works with such determination. As the years have passed she has added the sales of chicken and meat as well as fruit and vegetables. She is very kind when dealing with her clients and feels that this is what makes her business successful. She always tries to purchasing her goods ahead of time and wholesale. Keeping her store well-stocked helps to increase her sales. 

This is Maruja's first loan with Kiva. She is grateful for the financial backing she is receiving to help her move forward. She promises to pay her installments in a timely manner. At this time she hopes to use the 2000 PEN to buy wholesale products like bags of rice, sugar, canned goods, canned milk, fruit and vegetables.

loans.use: to buy food products.

loans.name: Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
Oñondivepa está en el idioma guaraní y quiere decir todas juntas, lleva este nombre ya que las integrantes todas juntas quieren luchar por ir mejorando. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 6 integrantes se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir con ingresos muy escasos.
Diana es parte de este grupo, quien con su esfuerzo y su sacrificio está saliendo adelante. Ella es una muy buena comerciante, se dedica a la venta de ropas y perfumes, y comenta que está mejorando bastante sus ventas, y es por eso que quiere seguir invirtiendo en ello. Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de ropas de variadas clases, y también en la compra de perfumes. Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo que le permitirá seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Oñondivepa is a word in the Guaraní language that means "everyone together". The group has this name because all of the members together want to fight to improve. They are taking the poverty elimination questionnaire, where 6 members are below the poverty line, which is to say they have very low income.

Diana is part of this group, and with her effort and her sacrifice she is moving forward. She is a very good businesswoman. She sells clothing and perfume. She says that her sales are improving quite a bit, and this is why she wants to continue to invest in it. She is asking for the loan in order to buy various kinds of clothing, and also to buy perfume. She is thankful for this opportunity she is receiving that will permit her to continue growing.

loans.use: to buy clothing and perfumes to sell

loans.name: Sambath

texts.en: Sambath is 43 years old. She is married and resides with her five children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $1 per day. Her husband is a soldier who earns about $4 daily. Two of her children are garment workers. They earn about $11 each day. Due to lack of funds, Sambath is requesting a loan of $1500 to purchase construction materials to build a bathroom and a kitchen. This money will help her improve the hygiene of her family's living conditions. In the future, she would like to expand her farming business and help her children access higher education.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build a bathroom and a kitchen

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en: As a married parent of eight children, Vilma works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Vilma is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional fishing materials for her fishing business. Vilma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing materials

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab is 30 years old and married with 3 children between the age of 9 and 12 years. She runs a wood business in Tombo Western rural area in Freetown. She started this business because she wanted to generate a permanent source of income.  

She has been in this business since her mother's funeral.  She sells wood at her house.  She describes her major hardship as inadequate funds to run her business and transportation problem.  

Zainab requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more wood to expand her business. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and improve her level of living. In the future, she would like to grow her business to a food store.  She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more wood to expand her business.

loans.name: Shiela

texts.en: Shiela is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a bakery business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 11,500 PHP through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like sugar, flour, margarine, eggs, etc. for her bakery business. Shiela has been in this business for 3 years. She earns additional income from pig fattening and vegetable farming. Shiela has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like sugar, flour, margarine, eggs, etc

loans.name: Clarissa

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Clarissa works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell fish business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from selling vegetables. Clarissa is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell for her buy-and-sell fish business.

Clarissa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Rosel

texts.en:
Rosel is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a beauty parlor business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase additional equipment for her beauty parlor business.

Rosel has been in this business for 10 years. Rosel earns more income from pig fattening.

Rosel has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional equipment for her beauty parlor business.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma tiene 35 años, está casada con Lucio y tiene 2 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. Es Propietaria de una tienda de productos comestibles en donde trabaja hace más de 5 años y es su principal fuente de ingreso para ella sus hijos. Se dedica a este negocio paralelo a sus labores en el campo ya que solo acude como apoyo a su pareja en temporadas de cosecha y mantenimiento pero al tener también la obligación de velar por sus pequeños hijos decidió habilitar el primer piso de su vivienda con ayuda de su esposo para establecer su actual negocio. Cuando comenzó uso los pocos ahorros que tenía para comprar mercadería como víveres y bebidas gaseosas que le sirvió para obtener sus primeras ganancias y surtir su negocio poco a poco. Tiene actualmente entre su mercadería productos  de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, cereales, golosinas, frutas y verduras.
Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y espera desde ya contar con la confianza necesaria para seguir adelante. En esta ocasión desea contar con 4,000 nuevos soles para comprar mercadería al por mayor como sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar, paquetes de gaseosa y cereales porque son los productos que tiene mayor demanda en su establecimiento.
texts.en:
Norma is 35 years old. She is married to Lucio and has 2 children, who live with her in her own house. She is the owner of a grocery store where she has worked for more than 5 years, and it is her principal source of income for her and her children. She does this work alongside her work in the fields, since she only goes to help her partner at harvest and maintenance times, but since she also has the obligation to watch over her small children, she decided to outfit the first floor of her house with the help of her husband to establish her current business. When she started she used the small savings she had to buy merchandise such as food and soft drinks, which were sufficient to obtain her first profits and stock her business little by little. She currently has among her merchandise staple goods such as rice, sugar, cereals, sweets, fruits, and vegetables.

This is her first loan with Kiva and from now on she hopes to have the confidence necessary to move forward. This time she wants to have 4,000 nuevos soles to buy wholesale merchandise such as bags of rice and sugar and packages of soft drinks and cereals because they are the products most in demand in her establishment.

loans.use: to buy grocery products such as rice, sugar, and soft drinks, among other items.

loans.name: Lailo

texts.ru: Лайло 37-летняя швея, проживает в северной части Таджикистана, в городе Конибодом. Она замужем и является матерью троих дочерей и одного сына. Ее муж работает таксистом по маршруту города. Сама Лайло зарабатывает на жизнь предоставляя услуги швеи. Она занимается данной деятельностью в течение 8 лет. Лайло опытная портниха, ее заказы всегда получаются красиво и ее клиентки остаются довольными ее работой. Ей в шитье и кройке помогают ее дочери, которым она научила свою профессию. Для развития своего швейного дела Лайло просит кредит, чтобы купить модернизированную вышивальную машинку. С помощью этой машинки она сможет делать вышивку на платьях, что увеличит источник ее дохода.
texts.en:
Lailo is a 37-year-old seamstress, who resides in the northern part of Tajikistan, in the town of Konibodom. She is married and is the mother of three daughters and one son. Her husband works as a taxi driver along the city routes. Lailo herself earns a living by providing sewing services. She has been engaged in this activity for eight years. Lailo is an experienced dressmaker. Her orders always come out beautifully and her clients are happy with her work. She is helped with the sewing and cutting by her daughter, whom she had trained in her profession. 

For the development of her sewing business, Lailo is asking for a loan to buy a modernized embroidery machine. With the help of this machine, she will be able to do embroidery on dresses, which will increase her source of income.

loans.use: to acquire a modernized embroidery machine

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell like soap, milk, sugar, canned goods, etc. for her general store business.

Ana has been in this business for 10 years and earns more income from fishing.

Ana has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to such as soap, milk, sugar, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: May Rose

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, May Rose works hard to support her family.

She has a dried fish making business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from motorcycle transport and raising pigs. May Rose is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy additional fish to process to dried fish for her dried fish making business.

May Rose has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to process to dried fish.

loans.name: Madelyn

texts.en:
This is Madelyn, 31, a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Ronald, a construction worker, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Madelyn operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. 

She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling them by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 25,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Madelyn hopes that her store will grow, and she dreams to have a good and a happy life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Muhamadobid

texts.ru:
Мухамадобид уроженец района Дж.Руми. Ему 43 года. Он занимается земледелием. Этим видом деятельности Мухамадобид занимается один, потому что двое его сыновей находятся в Российской Федерации. В районах и городах далеких от столицы мало рабочих мест и многие молодые юноши оставляют свои родные места и уезжают в заграницу, чтобы прокормить своих семей. В основном жители районов и сел занимаются сельскохозяйственной деятельностью. Потому что климат Таджикистана благоприятен и полностью пригоден для животноводства и растениеводства. Мухамадобид собирается начать бизнес по купле и продаже скота. Целью его кредита является закуп коров. Чтобы содержать и разводить скот у него имеются все условия. Благодаря кредиту он сможет иметь дополнительный источник дохода, финансовое состояние его семьи намного улучшится и он сможет женить своего старшего сына. 
Мухаммадобид заранее благодарен за представленный шанс.
texts.en:
Muhamadobid is a native of the J.Rumy region. He is 43 years old. He is engaged in farming. He is involved in this type of activity on his own because two of his sons are in the Russian Federation. In the districts and towns far from the capital, the are very few jobs and many young people leave their homes and travel abroad in order to feed their families. Most residents of the districts and villages are engaged in agricultural activities because the climate of Tajikistan is favorable and fully suitable for livestock and crop production. 

Muhamadobid is going to start a business buying ans selling cattle. The purpose of his loan is to buy cattle. He has all the conditions to care for and breed cattle. Thanks to the loan, he will be able to have an additional source of income and the financial condition of his family will be much improved, such that he will be able to support the marriage his eldest son. 

Muhamadobid gives his thanks in advance for getting a chance.

loans.use: to buy cows to start a new business and with the profits to hold a marriage for his son

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita is 58 years old and married, with three children.

Lucita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 19,500 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store, like canned goods, toothbrushes, toothpaste, noodles, and laundry soap.

Lucita has borrowed and paid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 18 years and also earns additional income from pig-fattening.

Lucita aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store, like canned goods, toothbrushes, toothpaste, noodles, and laundry soap.

loans.name: Elna

texts.en:
Elna is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Elna is 45 years old and has four children who are still in school.

Elna has a buy-and-sell livestock business in the Philippines. Elna requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to sell.

Elna has been in this business for five years. Elna would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to sell.

loans.name: Amigas De Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Amigas de Nueva Esperanza se formo con la unión de vecinas y amigas de la ciudad de Caaguazú, ellas están en su sexto ciclo, donde ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 7 integrantes necesitan trabajar más para poder mejorar su situación de pobreza.
Es parte de este grupo la Sra. Herodita, quien tiene una pequeña pero bien surtida despensa, que con mucho sacrificio ha ido ampliando y mejorando. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora, que con el tiempo quiere seguir ofreciendo una mejor comodidad a sus clientes y así mejorar los ingresos para poder ayudar a su familia. Ella esta agradecida por la oportunidad que está recibiendo que le será de mucha ayuda.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de verduras, carne, panificados, productos a granel y demás, con lo que podrá seguir dando a sus clientes lo que necesitan y ella a la vez seguir trabajando por mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Amigas de Nueva Esperanza is a group whose members are all neighbors and friends who live in the city of Caaguazú. They are in their sixth cycle and they participate in a study on the elimination of poverty. Seven of the members need to work to try to raise themselves out of poverty. 
One of the members of this group is Mrs. Herodita, she has a small store, but a well stocked one, that she has sacrificed a lot for in order to see it expand and improve. She is a hard working and determined woman, who wants to continue offering a better service to her customers and also see her earnings increase in order to help her family. She is thankful for the opportunity that she is receiving because it will help her a lot. 
She is applying for this loan so she can purchase vegetables, meat, breads, grain products and more. With these products she will be able to continue giving her customers all that they need and she will also continue working to improve her earnings.

loans.use: purchase vegetables, meats, breads, grains and more.

loans.name: Rustamjon

texts.ru: Рустамчону 34 года. Он женат,  имеет одну дочь. Рустамчон является мастером по ремонту квартир. Но сейчас не сезон его деятельности. Обычно жители Худжанда делают ремонты только весной и летом, когда жарко. Рустамчон делает ремонт только по заказу. Сейчас осень и заказы у него отсутствуют. Осенью и зимой у него нет работы, поэтому он решил начать новый бизнес и заняться оптовой продажей мобильных телефонов. В этом начинающем бизнесе ему будет помогать родственник, который занят в этой сфере. Рустамчон не имеет опыта в этой области, поэтому он не хочет рисковать и берет в кредит маленькую сумму. Сумма кредита является маленьким для оптовика, но он надеется, что для начинающегося бизнеса хватит. Рустамчон надеется на лучшее, а мы желаем ему удачи!
texts.en:
Rustamjon is 34 years old. He is married and has one daughter. Rustamjon is a master repairman for apartments. But now is not the season for his activities. Typically, residents of Khujand do repairs only in the spring and summer when it is hot. Rustamjon does repairs only on request. 

Now it is autumn and the orders are gone. In autumn and winter, he does not have work, so he decided to start a new business in wholesale trade of mobile phones. In starting this business, he will be helped by a relative who is engaged in this sphere. Rustamjon does not have experience in this sphere, so he does not want to risk it and is borrowing only a small amount. The amount of the loan is small for a wholesaler, but he hopes that it will be enough to start the business. 

Rustamjon hopes for the best and we wish him good luck!

loans.use: to start a business selling mobile phones

loans.name: Juvith

texts.en: Juvith has been operating her fish pond for 10 years. She resides at Tangub City in the Philippines, along with her family. She has been a member of GDMPC since 2009 and her previous loan used to improve her business was successfully repaid. Juvith is seeking a new loan of 14,500 PHP to purchase feed. She hopes to have a good harvest and to be able to generate more profit to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish and crabs to raise

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es:
Tomasa tiene 58 años, es viuda y tiene el orgullo de haber apoyado a sus hijos hasta ser personas mayores e independiente. Desde muy niña creció en un entorno donde la agricultura era el principal sustento de muchas familias en su comunidad ya que creció en el seno de un hogar humilde. Años después y al comprometerse se inició de manera independiente y adquirir rápidamente su primer terreno para obtener ingresos con la producción y venta de cacao orgánico.Fue así que al lado de su esposo empezó a proyectarse muchos objetivos a largo plazo. Tras el deceso de su esposo se vio en la necesidad de asumir el doble rol maternal.
Su labor principal consiste en mantener óptimas las plantaciones de cacao que posee en las 2 hectáreas de cultivo que son de su propiedad. Suele contratar trabajadores para que le apoyen en las tareas de deshierbo, cosecha y aplicación de abono orgánico. Le agrada mucho su trabajo ya que es una labor que desempeña toda su vida, no obstante en muchas ocasiones el clima y otros factores de la naturaleza dificultan sus tareas productivas. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y espera contar con la confianza necesaria para seguir adelante, además se compromete a seguir adelante. En esta oportunidad desea contar con 2,000 nuevos soles para la compra de abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Tomasa is 58 years old. She is a widow and has the pride of having supported her children until they were grown and independent. Since she was very young, she grew up in an environment where farming was the main sustenance of many families in her community, since she grew up in the bosom of a humble household. Years later, upon getting engaged, she started to work independently and rapidly acquired her first piece of land in order to earn income producing and selling organic cacao. It was in this way, at the side of her husband, that she started to plan many long-term goals. After the death of her husband, she found it necessary to assume a double maternal role.

Her main work consists in maintaining in optimal condition the cacao crops she has on the 2 hectares of farmland that she owns. She usually hires workers who help her with the tasks of weeding, harvest, and applying organic fertilizer. She likes her work very much, since it is work she has done all her life. Nevertheless, on many occasions the climate and other natural factors make her productive work difficult. This is her first loan with Kiva, and she hopes to have the confidence necessary to move forward. She also promises to move forward. At this time, she wants to have 2,000 nuevos soles to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Jocelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from fruit and vegetable vending. Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers for her fish-vending business.

Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
This is Susan, 52, a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is a widow and has five children. She and her children manage their household while operating a variety store business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns a profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 19,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Susan dreams that her business will continue to flourish and hopes that her children will always be in good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita works hard to support her family. Julita is married and has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines.

Julita requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Julita has been in this business for three years now.

Julita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 46 years old and single. Lydia works very hard to provide for her family.

Lydia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to buy more goods to sell in her general store.

Lydia has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as bread, cooking oil, sugar, coffee and candies. 

In the future, Lydia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell in her general store

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 30 years old and married with two children.

Analyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell.

Analyn has been in this business for four years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Analyn aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Marjona

texts.ru:
Марчона молодая незамужняя девушка в возрасте 22 лет. Она проживает в городе Душанбе в доме родителей. После окончания школы, три года тому назад Марчона научилась кройке и шитью у своей подруги. С тех пор она у себя дома принимает заказы на шитьё женских национальных платьев и на сегодняшний день она уже имеет своих постоянных клиентов. Ей в деятельности помогает мать. Марчона сейчас берет кредит для развития своего швейного дела. На сумму кредита она хочет купить компьютерную швейную машинку.      
У Марчоны большие планы на будущее. Она планирует открыть собственный швейный цех.
texts.en:
Marjona is a young, unmarried woman of 22. She resides in the city of Dushanbe in her parents' home. After graduating from school three years ago, Marjona learned to cut and sew from her friend. Since then, she has been taking orders from home for sewing women's national dresses and now she already has her own loyal customers. She is helped in these activities by her mother. 

Marjona is now requesting a loan to develop her sewing business. With the loan amount, she wants to buy a computerized sewing machine.      

Marjona has big plans for the future. She plans to open her own shewing shop.

loans.use: to buy a computerized sewing machine to develop her sewing business

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en: Anecita is a widow with two children who resides in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Anecita sells coconut wine to earn a living. She has been in this business for more than eight years and earns PHP 5,000 each month. Anecita has been a member of GDMPC since 2007 and her previous loan used to purchase coconut wine has successfully repaid. Her the business runs smoothly. Recently, she borrowed a new loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase fertilizer for her corn farm. She wants to improve the general living condition of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Rene

texts.es: Rene, de 56 años, está casado y tiene 03 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. El trabajo de Rene consiste en la crianza de ganado vacuno, el se levanta muy temprano para sacar a los animales de su corral, se encarga de darles su alimento y luego los lleva al campo. Lleva más de 11 años en este trabajo y recién hace 06 años empezó con la crianza de su propio ganado, lo bueno es que puede ganar como guardián de estos terrenos de culivo y al mismo tiempo tiene en la mira a sus animales, este trabajo lo realiza a lado de su esposa quien esta siempre ahí para apoyarlo. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que es tranquilo y además de ver como sus animales crecen de a poco mientras les da su cuidado.Este es su sexto crédito con Kiva, por ello solicita de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Además se compromete una vez mas de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado de S/.3500 soles para la compra de abono orgánico.
texts.en: Rene is 56 years old, married and has three children who all live together in their home. Rene works raising cattle. He gets up very early to take the animals from their corral, and then he feeds them before he leads them to the fields. He has been raising cattle for 11 years and he began raising his own about 6 years ago. The good thing is what he can gain some money as the care taker of these fields and also be able to watch over his herd. His wife helps him in his work and she is always there to support him. What he likes about his job is the peacefulness and getting to watch the animals grow while they are under his care. This is his sixth credit with Kiva and he is applying again in order to see his plans through. He also promises once again to be punctual in his repayments. With the loan he will purchase organic fertilizer.

loans.use: purchase organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Roberto de 47 años, está casado con Mildre quien tiene tres hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. El trabajo de Roberto consiste en la siembra de productos regionales, el se encarga de sembrar y cosechar en su terreno a donde  se dirige a diario a ver sus sembríos para brindarles cuidado cultivarlos y regarlos, ya que cree que para que tenga una buena cosecha tiene que darle mucho cuidado a sus cultivos, recién se esta iniciando en este esta actividad como negocio propio, trabaja solo y en algunas ocasiones contratará a otras personas para que le ayuden en la siembra y cosecha para poder tener todos sus productos y pedidos a tiempo.
Este es su sexto crédito con Kiva, por ello solicita de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes, por otro lado se compromete una vez mas de cumplir con el pago puntual de todas sus cuotas.
Con el monto solicitado de S/.2500 soles comprará abono orgánico para sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Roberto, 47 years old, is married to Mildre. He has three children with whom he lives in his own house. Roberto grows regional produce. He is in charge of planting and harvesting on his land. He goes there every day to see his crops in order to care for, cultivate, and water them, since he believes that in order to have a good harvest, he has to take very good care of his crops. Recently he started doing this work as his own business. He works alone and sometimes he will hire other people to help him with the planting and harvest in order to have all his produce and orders on time.

This is his sixth loan with Kiva, so he is asking for your collaboration so that he can carry out his plans. On the other hand, he promises again to make all of his loan repayments on time.

With the amount requested of 2500 soles, he will buy organic fertilizer for his crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
This is Marilyn, 47, resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is already a widow and she has children. She, together with her children, manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Marilyn sells chicken. She orders chicken and there are customers who buy raw chicken from her. But she mainly offers fried chicken necks. She put different seasonings, fries them, and then sell them. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 19,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies of chicken and different seasonings. 

Marilyn dreams that her business will continue to grow and hopes to have other outlets. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more chicken and different ingredients needed in her business.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann works hard to support her family. Mary Ann is married and has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines.

Mary Ann requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Mary Ann has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Mary Ann would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Nelisa

texts.en:
Nelisa is a 52-year-old married woman with four children who are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Nelisa has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines. Nelisa requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice to sell.

Nelisa has been in this business for two years. In the future, Nelisa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en:
Visitacion is 36 years old, married and has two children who are in school.

Visitacion is in the agricultural business, raising cattle in the Philippines. Visitacion requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to purchase vitamins, vaccines and other supplies for her cattle.

Visitacion has been raising cattle for three years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Visitacion would like to save enough money so she could afford to continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins, vaccines and other supplies for her cattle

loans.name: Nidy

texts.es:
Nidy es una joven de 20 años es madre soltera de 2 hijos con quienes vive en una casa alquilada. Desde temprana edad aprendió la difícil vida laboral del campo ya que tenía la gran responsabilidad de mantener a sus pequeños. Inicialmente contaba con el firme apoyo de su esposo pero tras su separación se empezó a desempeñar de manera independiente y con el apoyo de sus padres trabajando junto a ellos en el campo.
Tiene conocimientos en las labores agrícolas tales como el mantenimiento y producción de cacao orgánico ya que es uno de los productos que su familia siempre cultivó por herencia. Al ser muy proactiva ha logrado junto a sus padres llevar a campo una buena campaña productiva contratando a su vez jornaleros del lugar para las distintas tareas y motivando el uso de abonos orgánicos tales como el guano de aves para obtener una mejor calidad de las cosechas.Al transcurrir ya varios años ha visto por conveniente adquirir una pequeña parcela e iniciarse en la producción de cacao por su cuenta ya que espera con el tiempo mejorar su situación económica y el de sus hijos ya espera brindarle una buena ecuación para que sean mejores personas que ella según comenta.
Uno de sus principales objetivos a largo plazo es poseer una cantidad considerable de terrenos agrícolas y obtener a su vez mejores ingresos. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y a pesar de ser joven es conocida en su localidad como una persona muy responsable.  En esta oportunidad desea contar con 3,000 nuevos soles y junto a sus ahorros adquirir un pequeño terreno para iniciarse de manera independiente en el cultivo de cacao orgánico.
texts.en:
Nidy is a young woman of 20 years old, who is a single mother of two children.They live in a rented house. From an early age she learned the demanding task of working the land and now she has the large responsibility of supporting her two children. At first she had the solid support of her husband but after their separation she started to work independently.  She now works with the help of her parents. 

Nidy is knowledgeable about various agricultural activities like the production and maintenance of organic cocoa, which is one of the products her family has traditionally grown. Being a very proactive person she has managed along with her parents to have a very good growing season, using day labor to carry out the various tasks. She has pushed the using of organic fertilizer like guano to obtain a higher quality harvest. 

With the passing of the years Nidy has come to think it convenient to purchase a small plot of land and start the production of cocoa of her own. She hopes to improve her economic situation and she comments that she hopes to be able to offer her children a good education so they can be better people. One of her long term goals is to own a considerable amount of agricultural land and with that generate more revenues.

This is Nidy's first loan with Kiva and in spite of her young age she is known in her community as a very responsible person. At this time she is requesting 3000 PEN and together with her savings she will buy a plot of land where she can begin her own organic cocoa plantation.

loans.use: to buy a small plot of agricultural land.

loans.name: Yelena

texts.es: Yelena, de 40 años, está casada y tiene un hijo de 06 años con quien vive en su casa propia. El trabajo de Yelena consiste en la venta de bebidas gaseosas heladas como gaseosas de distintos sabores y cervezas de diversas marcas. Además tiene un mototaxi que alquila por el cual recibe un buen pago. Lleva haciendo estas actividades recién por dos años y cuenta con el apoyo de conviviente. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es que trabaja a lado de su hijo, a quien puede cuidar y ayudar en sus tareas de la escuela en su tiempo libre. Su casa esta ubicado en un punto estratégico y por ello tiene clientes todos los días y todo el tiempo, esto le genera buenas ventas y buenas ganancias, espera poder mantener su negocio ya que se siente cómoda con lo que tiene. Este  será su crédito  número 06 con Kiva, por ello solicita de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero para poder continuar con su trabajo. Con el monto solicitado 3500 soles, comprará repuestos para su mototaxi además de bebidas para su negocio.
texts.en: Yelena, 40 years old, is married and has a 6-year-old son, with whom she lives in her own house. Yelena's work is selling cold carbonated beverages, such as soft drinks of different flavors and different brands of beer. She also has a motorcycle taxi that she rents and for which she receives good payment. She has been doing these activities for just two years, and she has the support of her partner. What she likes about her work is that she works alongside her son. She can care for him and help with his schoolwork in her free time. Her house is located in a strategic spot, and because of this she has customers every day and all the time. This generates good sales and good earnings for her. She hopes to be able to maintain her business, since she feels comfortable with what she has. This will be her 6th loan with Kiva, so she is asking for your collaboration so she can carry out her plans. She is very happy to know that she will have financial support to continue with her work. With the amount requested of 3500 soles, she will buy spare parts for her motorcycle taxi as well as drinks for her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and carbonated beverages

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en: Elenita is 45 years old, married and the mother of two children. She works very hard to provide for them by running a general store in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 14,000 loan from NWTF to buy more items to sell such as soft drinks, biscuits, candies, canned goods, etc. Elenita has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items. Her goal is to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: Norma runs a general store in the village of Liposong, Ozamiz City, which is where her family lives. She supplements her income by running a farm where she grows corn and root crops. She has been a member of GDMPC since 2007 and successfully used a previous loan to improve her store. She is requesting a new loan for 10,000 PHP to buy more grocery items to sell. She plans to use the profits she earns to pay for the education of her children and meet her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to sell

loans.name: Twiyubake Group

texts.fr:
Salvator  fait partie du groupe  Twiyubake et  habite à Cibitoke. Il a 53 ans et est marié à Joselyne, une commerçante.
Il a sous sa charge 2 enfants.

Il fait le commerce du riz, haricot, sel,… depuis  2 ans. 

C’est son  premier  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter  30 kg de riz et 40 kg de haricot et 50 kg de sel, à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait  acheter une belle maison  et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Salvator is a member of the Twiyubake group and lives in Cibitoke. He is 53 years old and married to Joselyne, a shopkeeper. He has two children in his care.

Salvator has been in the business of rice, beans, salt, etc. for 2 years. This is his first loan with Turame. With this Kiva loan, he will increase his business capital and purchase 30kg of rice, 40kg of beans, and 50kg of salt, to resell and increase his earnings. In the coming years, he would like to buy a nice home and see his children educated.

loans.use: to increase his business capital and purchase 30kg of rice, 40kg of beans, and 50kg of salt, to resell and increase his earnings

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
The borrower is a bona fide resident of Katipunan, Zamboanga Del Norte. She is 43 years of age, married and has 2 children who are already adults. They have a good family background in their community.

The member has a profitable grocery store business and it has already existed for 2 years. Her business is very successful because she is financially literate. She wants to succeed through her business because she can use her profits for the needs of her family, especially the education of her children. This is her 2nd loan from Paglaum MPC, with no record of default in her previous loan.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for her grocery store

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business making foam beds in the Philippines.

Elisa requested a 60,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her business. She has been in this business for 13 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Elisa would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her business

loans.name: Edson

texts.en:
Edson, 51, is an experienced maize (corn) and dairy farmer, with a family of sixteen from the area of Kabwe District, Zambia.  He is asking for a Kiva loan to buy a maize milling machine so that he can provide a milling service to over 100 families in his community. 

The maize milling machine takes raw maize (corn) and creates a maize flour which is the staple food in Zambia.  Most rural families in Kabwe District grow maize on their small farms and store it to use as their primary supply of food for the year.  After the kernels are removed from the cob, they then have to be milled to create flour, which can then be boiled to make what is locally called Nshima.  Edson is already a well-respected maize and dairy farmer in his community and wants to expand his business to offer the maize milling service. 

Rent-to-Own has done market research in Edson’s community and has determined that the location for this equipment is ideal.  The closest maize mill is 20km away, but is often broken down.  This means most potential customers have to travel more than 30km to a nearby town, and since most will walk or use their bicycles to travel to the maize mill, it is certain they will prefer to use this maize mill rather than traveling a longer distance. 

Equipment such as a maize mill can be a major boost for many enterprising farmers such as Edson, as it allows for him to diversify his business.  Unfortunately, the upfront costs of such a maize mill are very prohibitive.  Once he secures a loan, Edson will be able to get a maize mill from Rent-to-Own, which will deliver the equipment to his farm, as well as provide training on how to use and maintain it. 

This loan will help Edson on the path to building up a viable business that can provide for his family and community throughout the year.  It is for this reason Edson is asking Kiva lenders to help him with the loan so that he can secure a maize mill as soon as possible.

loans.use: to obtain a maize milling machine

loans.name: Elisapeta

texts.en:
Elisapeta is a 59-year-old widow with 5 children. She has a small taxi business. She has many years with this business.

Elisapeta needs a loan to buy a secondhand taxi vehicle to increase the numbers of taxis in her business. She will use her profits to buy more vehicles so that she will have her own taxi stand to serve her community and also to support her family. Elisapeta joined SPBD in 2007 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a secondhand taxi vehicle

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing 29,500 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Elizabeth has been in this business for 15 years. Elizabeth earns more income from a general store.

Elizabeth has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en: Marcelina runs a direct-sales business which specializes in cosmetic products. She has been running this business since 2002, and supplements her income by farming. She is married and the mother of six children, four of whom are married and one of whom lives overseas. Her youngest child is still in school. Marcelina is requesting this loan for PHP 20,000 to buy stocks of cosmetic products such as lotions, perfumes and make-up kits in order to fill a large number of orders. She would like to grow her business so that she can let her youngest child finish her studies and also secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products such as lotions, perfumes and make-up kits for her direct-selling business.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en: Ester is married and the mother of one child. She manages a service-based business in which she provides transportation to people. Her husband also works in the business. Basically, they carry customers and baggage around town. She joined GDMPC recently and borrowed 15,000 PHP  to finance motorcycle maintenance so that she could offer better service to her costumers. She plans to use the profits she earns to expand her business.

loans.use: to pay for motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 42 years old and married with one kid who is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Arlene has a business selling firewood in the Philippines. Arlene requested a 50,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of firewood to sell.

Arlene has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Arlene would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her child to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of firewood to sell

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es:
El Sr. Rolando tiene 28 años, está acompañado con un hijo hace varios años. El se desempeñaba como vendedor de una firma de venta de electrodomésticos y de a poco fue juntando su dinero para hacerse de capital y montar un local de venta de repuestos, a la fecha su local se encuentra próspero y creciendo cada día más.
Comenta que tiene una buena cantidad de clientela bien formada, que siempre compra de él, y así va ganándose la vida y luchando para poder darle a su hijo todo lo que necesita.
Solicita de este crédito para poder comprar más repuestos, y así seguir trabajando y mejorando su servicio para con sus clientes. Esta muy agradecido por la oportunidad que está recibiendo, que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Sr. Rolando is 28 years old, has been in a relationship for several years, and has one child.  He works as a salesperson for a firm that sells household appliances.  Rolando gradually saved up enough money to use as seed capital for opening a spare parts shop.  As of this date, his shop is prospering and growing each day.  

He says that he has a well-established clientele that consists of good customers who always buy from him.  This enables him to earn a living and to provide everything his son needs.  Rolando is requesting this loan so the he can buy more spare parts, which will allow him to continue working and improving the service to his customers.  He is very grateful for the opportunity he has received, which will be of great help.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to sell.

loans.name: El Tucán Group

texts.es: El grupo lo conforman tres socias de negocio una de ellas es Digmara mujer de 33 años de edad, acompañada, con dos hijos de 6 y 3 años, su negocio es la venta de tortillas en su domicilio desde hace 5 años. Tiene de ser cliente de la institución 5 años, el crédito lo solicita para comprar fletes de leña, quintal de maíz, cal. Luz mujer de 44 años de edad su negocio es la venta de frutas y verduras y Karen joven de 22 años su negocio es la venta de ropa usada.
texts.en: The group consists of three business partners. One of these partners is Digmara, a woman of 33 years of age. She has two children aged six and three. Her business is selling tortillas from her home which she has done for five years. She has been a customer of this microfinance institution for five years, and she requests this loan to buy firewood, a bushel of corn, and lime to make tortillas. Luz is a 44-year-old woman whose business is the sale of fruits and vegetables, and Karen is a young woman of 22 years who has a business selling used clothing.

loans.use: to purchase firewood, corn, and lime to make tortillas

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: María es una mujer emprendedora de 58 años de edad, soltera, su negocio es la elaboración de repostería y venta de cosméticos por catálogo de la Avon, Zermat y Estilo desde hace 5 años, sus productos los comercializa en su comunidad. El crédito lo solicita para la compra al contado de productos de estilos, Zermat y Avon como perfumes, lencería, sombras, pinturas de uñas, labiales.
texts.en: Maria is an enterprising 58-year-old single woman. Her business is making pastries and selling cosmetics from the Avon, Zermat and Estilo catalogs. She has sold these products in her community for five years. She requested this loan to purchase products from Zermat and Avon such as perfumes, lingerie, eyeshadows, nail polishes, and lipsticks.

loans.use: to purchase products from Zermat and Avon such as perfumes, lingerie, eyeshadows, nail polish and lipsticks

loans.name: Twishingane Group

texts.fr:
Tharcisse fait partie du groupe  Twishingane et  habite à Gitega. Il a 33 ans et  est marié.Il a 5 enfants âgés de 2 à 13 ans dont 3 étudient.

Il fait le commerce de l’huile de palme depuis  8 ans. 

Il est à son troisième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de bidons d’huile de palme (8 bidons), à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Tharcisse is part of the group Twishingane and lives in Gitega. He is 33 years old and is married. He has 5 children from 2 to 13 years old of whom 3 study.

He has been selling palm oil for 8 years.

He is on his third loan with Turame. With the KIVA loan that he receives, he is going to increase his capital and buy a lot of cans of palm oil (8 cans), to resell to make more.

loans.use: to buy 8 cans of palm oil.

loans.name: Falconeri

texts.en:
Falconeri is 53 years old and married, with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more groceries to sell.

Falconeri has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

Falconeri aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: José Delio

texts.es: José tiene 61 años de edad y desde hace 30 años se dedica a la actividad de producción agropecuaria, pues la mayor parte de su vida productiva se dedicó a laborar en una empresa cultivadora de flores y, desde hace un año aproximadamente recibió su pensión, dinero con el que alquiló un lote para dedicarse a la producción de ganado de levante y lechero, además tiene una huerta donde cultiva tomate, cilantro, cebollas, coles, arveja y fríjol, productos que comercializa entre los vecinos del sector donde reside y de esta forma obtiene los recursos suficientes para solventar los gastos básicos de su familia, conformada por su esposa y 4 hijos. El cliente es un señor dedicado, trabajador y pujante. Solicita el crédito como apoyo para continuar con su labor, pues desde comprar una vaca productora de leche y adicionalmente cancelar el saldo de un crédito que tiene vigente, de esta forma ampliará su producción de leche y podrá satisfacer la alta demanda del producto, lo que se reflejará en el incremento de los ingresos familiares. José desea continuar trabajando por su familia hasta el último momento pues son ellos quienes lo motivan para levantarse y seguir luchando día a día, con el fin de poder disfrutar los frutos de su ardua labor junto a las personas que ama.
texts.en: José is 61 years old and he has been working in agriculture and livestock for 30 years now.  He spent the greater part of his productive life working for a flower-growing business and it has been about one year since he started receiving his pension.  He used that money to rent a plot of land to raise juvenile cattle and dairy cattle.  He also has a vegetable garden where he grows tomatoes, cilantro, onions, cabbages, peas, and beans, which he sells to his neighbors in the area.  In this way, he makes enough income to cover basic expenses for his family, which is made up of his wife and four children.  He is a dedicated, hardworking, and strong man.  He is asking for this loan to help him continue with his work, as he will buy a dairy cow and pay off the balance of an outstanding debt.  This will increase his milk production and allow him to meet the high demand for this product, which will in turn increase his family's income.  José wants to keep working for his family until the very end because they are what motivates him to get up and keep striving day after day.  He wants to be able to enjoy the fruits of his hard labor with the people he loves.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow and to pay off an outstanding debt

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es: Zoila, de 59 años, es madre separada y tiene 05 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. Zoila se dedica a la agricultura, se va a cultivar, regar y preparar la tierra para sus sembríos, además ella se dedica a la miel de abeja y sembrío de productos regionales. Viene trabajando ya por más de 30 años dedicándose a está actividad. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene tiempo y puede compartirlo con sus hijos, tiene buenas ventas ya que los productos que le dan sus tierras son muy buenos, lleva sus productos al mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Pucallpa en donde están sus compradores la esperan para hacer negocio. Este será su crédito número 06 con Kiva, por ello solicita de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero para poder continuar con su negocio.Con el monto solicitado de S/.3000 soles comprará abono orgánico y semillas para sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Zoila, who is 59 years old, is separated and has five children that live with her in the home she owns. Zoila is a farmer. She works cultivating, watering, and preparing the land for her crops. She also produces honey and grows regional products. She has been working in this business for over thirty years. What she likes about her work is that she has time to share with her children. Sales are good because the products she obtains from her land are very good. She takes her products to the wholesale market in the city of Pucallpa, where her customers await her to conduct business. 

This will be her sixth loan through Kiva, which is why she is now requesting their cooperation in order to carry out her plans. She is very happy to know she will have the financial support to keep her business going. She will use the requested amount of 3,000 soles to buy seeds and organic fertilizer for her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Nain

texts.es:
Nain, de 34 años, está casado y tiene 02 pequeños hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. La actividad que realiza Nain es el alquiler de su vehículo de carga pesada o mercaderías, para eso tiene un vehículo que compró con su propio capital de dinero. Hace 10 años que viene realizando este oficio, diariamente se dirige al puerto fluvial de la ciudad en busca de sus clientes a los que brinda su servicio de manera amable, cordial y con mucha responsabilidad. Paralelamente se dedica a la siembra de productos regionales como plátano y yuca. Le gusta su trabajo pues le brinda los ingresos económicos que necesita, además esta labor le permite tener un oficio que es muy solicitado por la población. Tiene planes de ampliar su negocio y comprarse otro vehículo de transporte para incrementar sus ingresos económicos. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 4000, por tanto se siente agradecido con todas las personas que le brindan el préstamo que necesita para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Con el monto solicitado comprará repuestos como llantas, sistema de arrastre y pagará el servicio del mecánico por la refacción de su vehículo.
texts.en:
Nain, 34 years old, is married and has two small children with whom he lives in a house he owns. Nain has a business renting his vehicle for heavy loads or merchandise. For that he owns a vehicle that he bought with his own capital. He has had this business for 10 years. Every day he goes to the city’s river port in search of customers to whom he offers his services in a friendly, cordial and responsible manner. At the same time he plants regional crops, such as bananas and manioc. He enjoys his work since it provides the income he needs. As well, his business enables him to do work that is in great demand by the population.

Nain has plans to expand his business and purchase another transport vehicle in order to increase his earnings. At this time, he is requesting S/. 4,000. He is grateful to all the people who provide the funding that he needs in order to meet his goals. He is committed to making his payments promptly. He will use the loan to purchase replacement parts, such as tires and a towing system, and to pay a mechanic for his services repairing his vehicle,

loans.use: to purchase replacement parts for his vehicle

loans.name: Jesus Alonso

texts.es:
El Sr. Jose Alonso es originario de la cd de Moclova, vive en Piedras Negras desde hace 15 años, trabaja como vigilante en una empresa que se dedica a la extraccion de carbón desde hace 4 años, tiene una muy bonita familia conformada por su esposa y sus dos niñas a las cuales quiere mucho y tienen mucho parecido fisico a él.
Pide apoyo através de KIVA  para impermeabilizar el techo de su vivienda ya que con el que cuenta se encuentra muy deteriorado, y como es temporada de lluvia,  le entra agua por diferentes parte del techo de su vivienda  y por el momento tienen que poner cubetas para el agua, ya no quiere que su familia se sienta incomoda, para esto es necesario apoyarlo y hacer que cumpla su proyecto para que sus niñas puedan jugar sin ninguna dificultad dentro de su vivinda y ellos como papas no tener que estar preocupados.
texts.en:
Jose Alonso is originally from the city of Moclova. He has been living in Piedras Negras for fifteen years. He has been working as a security guard for a coal extraction company for four years. He has a beautiful family, which comprises his wife and two daughters, whom he loves very much and who look a lot like him. 

He is requesting support through Kiva to seal his home's roof, since the one he has is very deteriorated and during the rainy season water leaks through several parts of the roof. For now they have to use buckets to collect the water, but he doesn't want his family to live uncomfortably any more. That is why he needs support in order to carry out his project, so that his little girls can play inside the house without any problems and they, as parents, don't need to worry.

loans.use: to seal his home's roof.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Roberto tiene 43 años, es casado con Antonia y tiene 5 hijos que viven con el en su casa hecha de materia noble.  Se dedica a la agricultura orientado a la producción de cacao orgánico y otros productos  rentables de su zona. Se inició en esta labor hace más de 25 años  con ayuda de sus padres ya que siempre fue un hijo muy trabajador y honesto.Inicialmente recibió un terreno de que le cedieron sus padres e inicio a brindarles los cuidados necesarios de acuerdo a los conocimientos adquiridos y lograr a fin de campaña obtener la calidad deseada.
Cuenta con el firme apoyo de su esposa y de sus hijos, así como de trabajadores del lugar en temporada de deshierbo y cosecha.Uno de sus principales inconvenientes al iniciarse de manera independiente fue que no contaba con dinero suficiente para cubrir algunos gastos que requiere esta labor, tales como la compra de abono y el pago acostumbrado a los trabajadores que son necesarios para terminar sus tareas pendientes en un menor tiempo beneficiando la obtención de la calidad deseada.Actualmente posee 2  hectáreas y media de terreno donde sigue expandiendo sus plantaciones de cacao en beneficio de su económica para lograr con el tiempo realizar alguno de sus objetivos que es la construcción de su vivienda a base de material noble. Es el primer préstamo que con Kiva y espera desde ya acceder a esta buena oportunidad al igual que otros agricultores de su zona. Desea en esta ocasión contar con 3,000 nuevos soles para la compra de abonos orgánico para sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Roberto is 43, married to Antonia and has five children. They live in a home with a strong foundation made of bricks and cement. Roberto works in agriculture focused in the production of organic cacao and other cost-effective products from his region. 

He started this activity 25 years ago with his parents' help as he was always a very hardworking and honest son. At the beginning he received a piece of land from his parents and started working on it according to the skills he learned and to obtain at the end of season the desired quality.

He has the support from his wife and children, as well as from seasonal workers for weed cleaning and harvest.  One of the main inconveniences of starting as an independent farmer was that he didn't have enough money to cover some of the expenses needed by this activity, such as fertilizer and to pay the workers that are needed to get the work done in a shorter amount of time to get the desired quality.  He currently has 2 and a half acres if land where he continues to expand the cacao plants to benefit his economy and with time be able to achieve one of his objectives which is to build his own home, one with a strong foundation made of bricks and cement.  This is the first loan with Kiva and he hopes to be able to have access to this opportunity as soon as possible like other farmers of the region.  At this time, he wishes to borrow 3,000 PEN to buy organic fertilizer for his plantation.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer for his plantation.

loans.name: María Caridad

texts.es: María es una mujer de 66 años de edad, madre cabeza de hogar de 4 hijos, a los cuales ha sacado adelante luego de la separación con su esposo. Durante los últimos 6 años de su vida productiva se ha dedicado a trabajar en un restaurante como parrillera, por lo que ha obtenido mucha experiencia y conocimiento en el manejo de este tipo de negocio, por lo que desea independizarse y abrir su propio negocio de comidas rápidas, aprovechando que un conocido suyo le está dando la oportunidad de tomar un local para iniciar con su proyecto. El crédito que solicita lo quiere invertir en la compra de activos fijos (nevera, parrilla, mesas, sillas y horno) e insumos al por mayor (carnes frías, salsas, gaseosas, aceite, papas), con lo que podrá materializar su idea de negocio, de la cual espera obtener muy buenos resultados debido a la amplia experiencia que tiene en cuanto a comidas se refiere, además cuenta con el apoyo de dos hijas. María sueña con hacer de su negocio una fuente de ingresos rentable que le permita tener una estabilidad económica favorable para continuar velando por el bienestar de sus hijos y poder brindar una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: María is a 66-year-old woman, a mother, and the head of her household of four children, whom she has cared for since her separation from her husband.  During the last six years of her working life she has been employed at a restaurant as a grill cook.  This has given her a great deal of experience and knowledge about running that kind of business, which is why she wants to go out on her own and open her own fast-food business.  She is taking advantage of an opportunity given to her by an acquaintance to take over a space to start her project.  She wants to use the loan she is requesting to buy fixed assets (freezer, grill, tables, chairs, and oven) and wholesale supplies (cold meats, salsas, soft drinks, oil, potatoes), which will allow her to make her business idea a reality.  She hopes to get very good results because of her ample experience with prepared foods and because she can count on the help of her two daughters.  María's dream is to make her business a profitable source of income that will allow her to have the financial stability she needs to keep ensuring her children's wellbeing and to offer them a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fixed assets (freezer, grill, tables, chairs, and oven) and wholesale supplies (cold meats, salsas, soft drinks, oil, potatoes)

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.en:
Gregoria is 46 years old and married, with one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Gregoria has a general store business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more items to sell in her general store, like seasonings, shampoo, hair conditioner, cooking oil, and soft drinks.

Gregoria has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store, like seasonings, shampoo, hair conditioner, cooking oil, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice, beans, cured meats, vegetables, oil, and some canned goods.

loans.name: Reparto Andres Vega Group

texts.es: El grupo lo forman tres socias emprendedoras una de ellas es María mujer de 29 años de edad, soltera, con cuatro hijos de 10, 6, 5 y 3 años. Su negocio es la venta de fritanga desde hace 3 años, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de materia prima como es plátanos, queso, arroz, frijoles, repollo, zanahoria, carbón, tortillas, carne de res, carne de pollo,carne de cerdo, chiltoma, cebolla, tomate, naranja agria,achote, etc. Maritza mujer de 28 años de edad su negocio es la venta de zapatos y Seneyda mujer de 33 años  su negocio es la venta de tortillas.
texts.en: This groups consists of three entrepreneurial members. One of them is María, who is 29 years old, single, and a mother of four children, who are 10, 6, 5 and 3 years old. María owns a small restaurant that she has been running during the last 3 years; she is requesting this loan to buy charcoal and ingredients such as bananas, cheese, rice, beans, cabbage, carrots, tortillas, beef, chicken, pork, peppers, onions, tomatoes, oranges, achiote, etc. Maritza is 28 years old and she sells shoes, while Seneyda is 33 years old and she sells tortillas.

loans.use: To buy raw materials such as bananas, cheese, rice, beans, cabbage, carrots, tortillas, beef, chicken, pork, peppers, onions, tomatoes, oranges, achiote, etc.

loans.name: El Bienestar Group

texts.es: El grupo lo conforman tres socios de éxitos uno de ellos es Alexandra mujer de 30 años de edad, acompañada, con dos hijos de 14 y 9 años, su negocio es la venta de cosméticos por catálogo de Arabela desde hace 2 años. El crédito lo requiere para comprar cosméticos al contado como perfumes, pinturas de uñas, labiales, cremas faciales. Flavia mujer de 37 años su negocio es la venta de frescos, cuajada, queso, recargas y Edelberto hombre de 39 años de edad y su negocio es una carpintería.
texts.en: The “El Bienestar” group (The wellbeing group) has three successful members. One of them is Alexandra, who is 30 years old and lives with her partner and her two children, who are 14 and 9 years old. During the last two years Alexandra has worked selling cosmetics through the ‘Arabela’ catalogue, and she is now requesting this loan to buy additional cosmetics such as perfumes, nail polish, lipstick and facial creams. The other group members are Flavia and Edelberto. Flavia is 37 years old and sells soft drinks, curd and cheese, as well as credit for prepaid mobile phones, while Edelberto is 39 years old and he is a carpenter.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics such as perfumes, nail polish, lipstick and facial creams.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa, 47, is single and lives in Ho Chi Minh City. Hoa started the general store business to cover her expenses and to generate income to raise her children. 

She is requesting a loan to stock her store and expand her business by buying more household items and many kinds of soft drinks. She hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers and that she will be able to increase the turnover of her business. She hopes that, through the loan, she will be able to expand her business activities and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy household items and many kinds of soft drinks to stock her store.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene 49 años, esta casada con Justiniano y tiene 4 hijos que viven con ella en su casa propia. Hace mas 20 años se dedica a cultivar la tierra con el firme apoyo de su esposo gracias a un pequeño terreno que heredó de sus padres y que le sirvió para obtener sus primeros ingresos y adquirir las 2 hectáreas de terreno que posee actualmente. Comenta que al iniciarse tenia mucho temor ya que tampoco contaba con dinero suficiente  para la compra de insumos tales como abono orgánico y menos para la contrata de trabajadores viéndose obligada junto a su esposo a  trabajar muy duro a pesar de tener a sus primer hijo en brazos. Su labor principal consiste en brindarle le mejor de los cuidados posibles a sus plantaciones de café que tiene alrededor de sus terrenos ya que a diferencia de otros productos rentables de su zona requiere los respectivos cuidados para lograr una buena calidad comercial en la cosecha. Es por ello que fertiliza sus suelos solo con abono orgánico. Considera que la labor mas complicada es la cosecha de los granos cafeteros ya que es un trabajo que realiza contratando trabajadores para su posterior pelado y secado al aire libre. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y espera contar con la confianza necesaria para invertir en sus parcelas. En está oportunidad desea contar con 3,000 nuevos soles para la compra de abono orgánico para fertilizar sus cultivos de café.
texts.en:
María is 49 years old. She is married to Justiniano and has four children who live with her in her home. She has been cultivating the land for over twenty years with her husband's steady support thanks to a small plot of land she inherited from her parents and that served her to obtain her first earnings and acquire the five acres of land she currently has. She says she was very afraid when she first started because she didn't have enough money to buy supplies like organic fertilizer, let alone to hire workers, so she had to work very hard alongside her husband, even though she had to carry her first child in her arms. 

The main focus of her work is tending to the coffee crops she has surrounding her land as best as possible, because unlike other profitable products in her area, coffee requires specific care in order to achieve good commercial quality at harvest.
